options.systemMessage:
You are a helpful AI assistant analyzing laptop inventory and pricing data from Amazon and Target. 
You have access to complete product data and statistics.

When answering questions:
- Be specific and use actual data in your responses
- Compare prices when relevant
- Identify trends and insights
- Make recommendations based on the data

The data includes: product titles, prices, brands, ratings, and URLs.

ASUS Antimicrobial Guard is designed to inhibit bacterial growth by up to 99% over a 24-hour period, helping to keep your Chromebook sanitary***
US Military-grade durable, passing MIL-STD 810H standard

*** The antimicrobial treatment is tested by an independent third-party laboratory according to the ISO 22196 standard (measurement of antimicrobial activity on plastics and other non-porous surfaces), using bacterial cultures that include Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus, with antimicrobial activity (R) result of R > 2. certifiedBy.name: EPEAT
certifiedBy.description: EPEAT addresses the sustainability impacts of electronic products. An EPEAT registered product must meet required criteria and can meet optional criteria. The criteria depend on the type of product and can include energy efficiency, reduction of fluorinated greenhouse gases (F-Gases), and end of life management. Products meeting 50% - 75% optional criteria are â€œSilverâ€ and those meeting more than 75% are â€œGoldâ€.Learn more about this certification

features: SPEED OF LIGHTNESS â€” MacBook Air with the M4 chip lets you blaze through work and play. With Apple Intelligence,* up to 18 hours of battery life,* and an incredibly portable design, you can take on anything, anywhere.
SUPERCHARGED BY M4 â€” The Apple M4 chip brings even more speed and fluidity to everything you do, like working between multiple apps, editing videos, or playing graphically demanding games.

BUILT FOR APPLE INTELLIGENCE â€” Apple Intelligence is the personal intelligence system that helps you write, express yourself, and get things done effortlessly. With groundbreaking privacy protections, it gives you peace of mind that no one else can access your data â€” not even Apple.*
UP TO 18 HOURS OF BATTERY LIFE â€” MacBook Air delivers the same incredible performance whether itâ€™s running on battery or plugged in.*
A BRILLIANT DISPLAY â€” The 13.6-inch Liquid Retina display supports 1 billion colors.* Photos and videos pop with rich contrast and sharp detail, and text appears supercrisp.
LOOK AND SOUND YOUR BEST â€” Everything looks and sounds amazing with a 12MP Center Stage camera, three mics, and four speakers with Spatial Audio.
CONNECT IT ALL â€” MacBook Air features two Thunderbolt 4 ports, a MagSafe charging port, a headphone jack, Wi-Fi 6E,* and Bluetooth 5.3. And it supports up to two external displays.
APPS FLY IN MACOS â€” All your favorites run lightning fast in macOS, including Microsoft 365 Copilot, Adobe Creative Cloud, and Google Workspace.*

IF YOU LOVE IPHONE, YOUâ€™LL LOVE MAC â€” Mac works like magic with your other Apple devices. View and control whatâ€™s on your iPhone from your Mac with iPhone Mirroring.* Copy something on iPhone and paste it on Mac. Send texts with Messages from your Mac, or use your Mac to answer FaceTime calls.*
* LEGAL DISCLAIMERS â€” This is a summary of the main product features. See below to learn more.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the MacBook Air performs well as an upgrade from M1 models, with one noting it starts up in about 16 seconds. The laptop is praised for its speed, ease of use, and portability, while also receiving positive feedback for its color, quality, and battery life. Customers consider it good value for money.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Best Mac overall deal at 24 April price!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: If you find this at the 24 April price of $911 and purchase with your Prime card and 5% back, you'll get the lightest, most compact, top of the line M4 multicore processor for only $865. 16GB is enough RAM to run most games and nearly all productivity software with amazing speed and video performance. The internal 256GB drive is adequate especially if the plan is to add an external drive someday. Best Mac deal out there hands down.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2025
productPageReviews.variant: Capacity: 16GB Unified Memory, 256GB SSD Storage, Color: Sky Blue, Set: Without AppleCare+

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Perfect laptop! This laptop replace my 2011 MacBook Air. This laptop is fast, lightweight & of course, easy to use. Highly highly recommend this laptop! I purchased the 512 gb version in midnight color. I love the color, but it does tend to show fingerprints.  Overall a great purchase.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2025
productPageReviews.variant: Capacity: 16GB Unified Memory, 512GB SSD Storage, Color: Midnight, Set: Without AppleCare+

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Fast and Power Efficient Apply Air M4
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: My first Apple product purchased in my 77 yrs. I did not know what to expect, not from the hardware but with the Operating System. At first the OS was a little bit frustrating as I use a lot of charts, folders on MS Office and now I need to use Apple Numbers unless I purchase another MS Office for the new Mac. Humbers is very different making and using charts but I am getting the hang of it albeit that at times I need to use an extra step or two to get to where I want to go. Other than that I use Chrome and it is pretty much the same as on my other PCs.On the hardware. It starts up in about 16 seconds and moving around the internet and files is pretty much the same as my other PCs. I do a lot of photography and it supports that quickly and effeciently. I have not tried video editing yet but I do not expect to have too much of a problem there. Battery life is about 4 times longer than my now not working high powered ASUS Zephyrus Laptop which bugged me a lot.So in the end I would do it again if I needed to.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Same Apple Quality Product. It works~
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This is my second MacBook Air, but my first time ordering Apple products from Amazon. The laptop arrived quickly and in new condition. It is everything that I expected it to be. The funny or ironic thing about the laptop is, I never realized until I was literally writing this review, that there is a clear, thin, rubber covering over the keys. It feels so smooth, I didn't even notice it until my nail slightly slid under the covering. I think I am just going to keep the covering for protection. Otherwise, the product is the same as ordering direct from Apple, and seems to be functioning well. I'd purchase another.

From the manufacturer
The Next Generation Katana Reforged 
Up to the Intel Core i7-13620H Processor 
The 13th Gen. Intel Core i7 processor is here. With improved hybrid core architecture, 6 Performance-cores and 4 Efficient-cores, for better multitasking works and running demanding games. 
The Ultimate Play 
Geforce RTX 40 Series Laptops Beyond Fast 
NVIDIA GeForce RTX 40 Series GPUs are beyond fast for gamers and creators. They're powered by the ultra-efficient NVIDIA Ada Lovelace architecture which delivers a quantum leap in both performance and AI-powered graphics. Experience lifelike virtual worlds with ray tracing and ultra-high FPS gaming. 
Previous page

With the power of RTX 40 Series and third-gen RT Cores, you can experience incredibly detailed virtual worlds like never before. 
NVIDIA DLSS 3. Powered by AI. 
Powered by the new fourth-gen Tensor Cores and Optical Flow Accelerator on GeForce RTX 40 Series GPUs, DLSS 3 uses AI to create additional high-quality frames. 
NVIDIA Reflex. Victory measured in milliseconds. 
Built to optimize and measure system latency, Reflex provides faster target acquisition, quicker reaction times, and the best aim precision for competitive games. 
Discrete Graphics Mode. Spare No Performance 
Select between "Discrete Graphics Mode" or "MSHybrid Graphics Mode" (NVIDIA Optimus), the switchable graphics technology offers powerful gaming performance and efficiency.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the laptop performs well in gaming tasks and appreciate its speed, with one noting it runs games smoothly. The build quality is good, though opinions on durability are mixed - while some say it's stronger than their old laptops, others report it breaking irreparably within a month. The screen quality and battery life receive negative feedback, with customers reporting frequent blue screen crashes and less than 2 hours of battery life. Customers disagree on the value for money, with some finding it amazing for the price while others feel it's not worth the investment. Heat generation is also a concern, with customers noting it heats up rooms quickly.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Great laptop, battery life is 5-6 hours
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I bought this laptop a little over a month ago, and I use it every day, and it works wonderfully. I bought it for a little over $1000 at the end of January 2025. I'm a student who mostly plays modded minecraft.It's heavy and thick, but I enjoy that about it, and it's not the heaviest laptop among my friends. People really enjoy the light-up keyboard and I get lots of compliments. The choice of function keys is wonderful and I use them a lot.A lot of reviews claim that the battery life maxes at two hours, and I have no idea where that number is coming from- I regularly use my laptop for 5 or 6 hours unplugged before it dies. The charging cable is very heavy itself, but it's not too much of a pain to take along for longer work days or when I know I'll be doing something power-intensive.A lot of the pre-installed apps are annoying or useless, but I overall appreciate them.The fans have never gotten so loud that it was jarring to people around me, though I've certainly noticed them whirring while playing games in private.Ultimately, it's a great laptop that was very much worth the money for me. It's a gaming laptop with great memory, great graphics, and great storage. The battery lasts as long as I need it to, and it has a lovely shape and appearance. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a gaming laptop.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Itâ€™s no Macâ€¦ WiFi issues and power supply problems galore
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I felt like I did plenty of research going into this computer purchase, compared benchmarks and hardware to ensure I was making a choice in product that would last 3-5 years. Let me tell you, this laptop isnâ€™t it for my application.I needed a laptop to be mobile and edit content, primarily graphic design and 1-5 minute video editing. This includes using the entire Adobe suite with either one or multiple programs (not all at once). I found my experience with this laptop to be subpar at best. Right away I was leery of the AMD processor, I much prefer Intel. I cannot prove that this CPU was the root cause of all my issues, but I have a feeling it was a contributor. I was very disappointed with the lack of reliability, and it seemed every time I needed to use the laptop, there was some issue. And then of course if I gave it a little time it would finally come around, just enough for me to question if I could â€œmake it workâ€ in the long run. It got to the point where I started documenting the issues 2 days in and noted weird things I was finding since this laptop just didnâ€™t feel right. Below were several of the things I noticed in just over a week of owning and using daily. Keep in mind I came from a M3 Pro MacBook Pro prior to this.Delivered: 9/20/24Issues with laptop:Google chrome opens first search with bold text every time, super annoying. Incognito mode does same thing so doesnâ€™t seem to be an account setting/issueInitially opened using Yahoo as search engine with brand new Google Chrome download. Could have been an issue with previous extensions that I had, since I had logged into google first before searching anything9/23Laptop was at 10% and went into power saver, keyboard dimmed and brightness went down. Plugged it in for an hour, go to turn it on, black screen. Plugged into other outlet (neither outlet is switched) and it finally fired up 10 minutes later.9/25Got home and opened laptop, wonâ€™t connect to home WiFi, which itâ€™s been connected to for almost a week and has remembered. Turned WiFi off and on again, and now says No Wi-Fi Networks found. Need external WiFi adapter to use internet now.9/26Plugged in hard drive (offline) to work on project, computer wonâ€™t read hard drive. Previously Norton wanted to run a scan every time I plugged in, so not sure if thatâ€™s why itâ€™s not recognizing the drive but I wasnâ€™t able to do work off the SSD until I had WiFi again9/26Was editing a project with computer, closed lid for 15 minutes, came back and screen is black. Wonâ€™t turn on or restartâ€¦ 20 minutes later it turns on after deciding it wanted to be shut down, and tabs are now all closed and unsaved work lostâ€¦ not cool.9/28Finally used Adobe Premiere Pro for the first time on this device, playback is CHOPPY, it will play forward when previewing, then chop back a few frames, then play forward, they chop back a few frames. Not a clean simple playback to review my timeline and see how my project looksâ€¦Trackpad pinch to zoom doesnâ€™t zoom-in on timeline in Premiereâ€¦ throws off typical workflow, VERY annoying9/29Perfectly on queâ€¦ blue screen of death â€œRecoveryâ€ while turning onâ€¦ time to get a MacBook.Another odd thing: EVERY time the computer restarts MSI Center and Xbox re-pin themselves to the taskbarI also added quite a few add-ons to â€œtryâ€ making the laptop feel more like a Mac. I added things like 3 finger drag, spacebar preview, phone link, changed photoshop and Illustrator settings to allow pinch to zoomâ€¦ and even with all of this to help my workflow feel more like a Mac, the clunky computer workflow and unreliability kept me feeling disconnected from my work.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Love this, probably not for the unsavvy
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I bought this laptop after reading the negative reviews and also the reviews explaining how to fix most of the issues. So before I even turned this laptop on, I had all the updates ready to install and saved on an external SSD. First thing I did was update the BIOS and all the hardware drivers. I let Windows install all its updates as well. Then I went to work uninstalling all the bloatware, and let me tell you, there was SO MUCH. Most of it was actually Microsoftâ€™s doing (who TF needs a million different language versions of your trial Office products??).Everything was smooth sailing until I tried to game. Thatâ€™s when I realized that something was wrongâ€”the graphics were horrible. It wound up being that the onboard graphics card was overriding the Nvidia card. I had to not only disable it in device manager, but uninstall the software. That made the Nvidia card recognizable by all my apps and games.Now my games look fab and I adore this device. I have it on most of the day, every day, and have yet to encounter any issues.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the laptop performs well and is worth its affordable price. The device boots quickly and runs smoothly, with one customer noting it handles multiple tabs without lag. They appreciate its build quality, with one mentioning it's reliable for both work and leisure, and the back-lit keyboard makes it easy to use in dim environments. Customers like the graphics quality, with good colors on the screen, and the battery life receives positive feedback.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Does well what I expected it to do.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have had it for a couple of weeks now.  It came well enough packaged.  I did charge it fully before setting it up.  It took a good hour or so to jump through all the hoops to get it working (not too unusual for a new computer, I think), and it took a couple of days to finally get all the kinks ironed out and for it to be totally reliable and working.  Now it seems to work just fine, and it boots up almost instantly.My couple of complaints are:1:  The charging block is pretty large, and the plug blades are positioned in such a way that on a plug strip, you either cover two slots, or you must use the end of the strip.  I wish they had rotated the blades 90*.  It would take up less space on a strip.  Minor complaint, but still...2:  The keyboard is lighted, which is nice.  But the lights go out within a few seconds.  I wish there was a way to make them stay on longer.3:  It runs a bit hot, so I try to use it on some sort of flat surface so the vent on the bottom can be clear.  I think there may be a fan in there somewhere.  Again, a minor complaint,  Heat happens, and you gotta get rid of it4:  My biggest wish is that it had louder speakers.  The speakers face towards the side and bottom, and are not very loud at all.  More volume would be wonderful!  That would be my one thing I'd really like them to work on.  It is usable, but weak.  On the other hand, the computer is large (and a bit heavier than I expected) so those little speakers are on each end, and provide wonderful stereo separation.  I do enjoy having it on my lap and listening to some music videos on it.  I just wish it had more volume.So, the complaints aside, I think it is a good buy, and the price was very good.  For what it is, I could not come close anywhere else, and especially looking in some of the local brick and mortar stores.  I ordered it one day, and had it in hand the next, so good and quick delivery.Would I buy it again?  So far, yes indeed.  It does exactly what I wanted it for.  I don't do online gaming, so can't speak about that, but don't care anyway.  I would recommend it to anyone else wanting a low price but functional computer.  Two things I was looking for when I was shopping, was  a solid state drive, and 1T of size, which this model has, so that was one of the selling points as well.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2025
productPageReviews.variant: Style: 16GB RAM|1TB SSD, Color: Royal Blue

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Awesome and value for the money.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have been looking to buy a laptop.  Even went to a couple of big box stores.  For this price they were offering only 4-8 gigs of RAM.  Very basic looking and typical clunky ones at that.  My desktop needed replacement so I wanted a laptop that had ample speed and storage.  Lightweight and the 15 inch screen is full size - meaning it's edge to edge.Had been looking on Amazon and came across this one.  For the price of $299 (on sale) came away with 16 gigs of RAM and 1 TB of SSD storage!  Couldn't touch that in a store at that price.Received the laptop yesterday and upon unpacking, I was very impressed with it! Sleek, slim and just impressive!Fast to boot and easy to set up.  ABSOLUTELY LOVE THE KEYBOARD! The keys are velvety smooth and easy to type (I learned to type on a manual typewriter so that means I've been typing for a darn long time and know what a good key board is like!)The graphics are beautiful.  Was worried about quality purchasing online, but am absolutely blown away with this laptop.Would recommend!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2025
productPageReviews.variant: Style: 16GB RAM|1TB SSD, Color: Moonlight Silver

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Easy setup, Good Sound, Great Display Resolution
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Bought this computer one month ago.  The Display resolution and speaker sound is good.  Sound is so much louder than previous computer which allows me listen while doing chores away from computer.  Love the backlit keys for nighttime use.  Just the right size and weight for easy transport.I don't have a TV so this computer is my go to for news, research and entertainment at home.  It's speed and quality are good.  Microsoft's Office program works well with this computer.One complaint I have is what another person mentioned...the number keypad layout is not the usual set up which makes number entry slower for someone used to automatically entering numbers/decimals.  Also, the up/down/sideways arrows which normally are under the return key are to the right, making those keys awkward to use.  Aside from these two abnormalities, the keyboard works well and easy to use.The curser is very sensitive.  I often put it where I want to click and when I go to click the curser is not where it should be.  If you use a mouse, this should not be a problem, but I use my laptop w/o a mouse so it is a bit irritating.  Aside from these minor problems, this is a great laptop.Would definitely buy this product again.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2025
productPageReviews.variant: Style: 16GB RAM|1TB SSD, Color: Ruby Red

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: It seems pretty good so far, I had a heck of a time getting online because my wi fi connection is secured and there is no provision to enter a password the way Windows is set up.  With a lot of help from Google I found a way to force it into DOS and tell it I didn't have wi fi then kind if get into it with a "back door".  I had the same problem with another computer I had ordered and returned because I thought it was defective but in retrospect probably not.  The problem seems to be with Windows, not the computer.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: G16 review from a first time PC gamer
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I picked this labtop because I wanted to have more variety of games that I can play. I also wanted a laptop that can help launch my A.I projects. Evertime I load up this computer, I feel like I'm transported to another world.A world of vibrant colors and intense graphics. As a console gamer of 20+ years, I definitely feel the difference  , and can see why PC gamers refer to themselves as "the PC master race." As a fighting game nerd, the 165hz makes it easier to react to those slower moves that you can barely react to with a console that's locked at 60hz. This labtop has the personality of an advanced A.I sent from the future. I wonder what the XG27UCS is like?
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This laptop has been good.  Good WiFi connectivity is good.  Have not had any problem with connectivity.  Since this is a gaming laptop the keyboard can have different colored lights.  The gaming keys, qwerasdf are reverse lighted, so if I am typing in the dark it is good but in light it can be difficult to see the keys.  Durability has been good.  I carry it in a padded computer bag.  It has a good weight so if you are looking for a light weight computer this would not be good.  Cooling is very good for a gaming laptop.  I can keep the laptop on my legs without it getting really hot.  Design and layout is good.  Monitor connection to based looks very good.  It has a regular Ethernet port not the collapsible type in thin laptops which I like.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: BEST LAPTOP OUT THERE - ASUS ALL THE WAY
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I absolutely LOVE this gaming laptop. I have been wanting to get a laptop that would be great for playing high graphic games, and this laptop exceeded my expectations.The download speed for basically anything on this laptop is crazy fast. It took me by surprise. I don't think I have ever had any "gaming system" that has ever been able to download Fortnite in less than 5 minutes.I also really like the changing colors of the keyboard and bottom part. The fact that you can change it to different modes is really cool.Overall, I would highly recommend this computer, or even just any high performance ASUS Gaming Laptop.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I purchased the ASUS ROG Strix G16 gaming laptop in November 2024 as a Christmas gift to myself. I wanted to wait a few months and give it some serious work before writing a review.I wanted a gaming laptop that I could also use for some work applications as well. This laptop does everything I need and more! I've used it on games like World of Tanks, Fortnite and Call of Duty. The 16gb ram handles everything with no issues! I've recently started using it for some astrophotography processing and again, it does everything I need with no issues.I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but for the price and since most of the reviews were positive, I went ahead and pulled the trigger. And I'm glad I did! I have always bought from Dell and I was leaning that way again this time. Nothing against Dell, I've always had great success with them. But, for the price and what I got ... ASUS may be my new go to!If there is any downside, it would be the keyboard. The function is great, the lights are pretty cool, even though I just needed them be backlit, but the colors are ok too. But the only downsides to me are the Q,W,E,R,A,S,D and F keys are clear which make them hard to see. I assume it was done that way since they are the ones used most in gaming, but it's just an annoyance to me. The other issue is I would prefer a number pad on the right-hand side of the keyboard, this one doesn't have that. But neither issue is a deal breaker for me.I love this laptop! I definitely recommend it!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: My sister and I were both getting new laptops and my sister chose this one. Right off the bat we noticed how much smaller it was than anticipated. For reference, I previously had a 15inch computer and quickly saw this looked much smaller and I was correct.We measured and itâ€™s approx 13.5 inches with an active screen of about 13inches.This was really important since we needed laptops that would fully utilize the cintiq 16 aspect ratio and laptops of a smaller size usually results in a smaller working area on the tablet.My sister still wanted to try and see if 13 inches would be enough and sadly it was not. Itâ€™s a big shame too because the laptop seems very well made. Iâ€™ve had an ASUS in the past and it lasted me a while so I trust the manufacturer. The silent fans really ARE very silent. The quietest laptop weâ€™ve ever seen. The logo sound is a bit of a jumpscare when turning on the laptop though (itâ€™s the sound of two blades), but Iâ€™m sure thereâ€™s a way you can turn that off if youâ€™d like. We didnâ€™t get past the set up since we just wanted to see if it was compatible with the Cintiq.Making this review so that other people know about the incorrect size listing. If you donâ€™t mind getting a laptop thatâ€™s three inches smaller than anticipated then this seems like a good choice. If size does in fact matter to you then please look elsewhere. But also keep in mind, this isnâ€™t the only wrong size listing. The Acer 17 laptop I got was in fact 15 inches despite the description. 15 at least uses the full Cintiq work area so I didnâ€™t need to return mine but again itâ€™s weird that you have to assume that whatâ€™s listed in the description is going to be off by two to three inches. This is, technically, false advertising.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Overall amazing product for the value
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Really satisfied with this laptop for its price value and how much it surpasses in quality and performance in gaming. However, the downside is how fast the battery drains when gaming but should not be a problem if you regularly play while its charging. Its not too heavy well.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find this laptop to be of top quality, easy to set up, and appreciate its lightweight design that's easy to carry. Moreover, the battery life is impressive, and they consider it good value for money. However, the functionality receives mixed reviews, with some saying it works well for basic functions while others report it doesn't work at all. Additionally, the laptop's performance is slow, with apps taking 3-5 minutes to load and updates taking up to 2 hours.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The HP Stream 14" HD BrightView Laptop is a budget-friendly device designed for basic tasks such as browsing, emailing, and word processing. With its sleek silver design and impressive specs, this laptop is an excellent option for students, professionals, and anyone looking for an affordable yet reliable device.*Pros*1. *Affordable*: The HP Stream 14" is an excellent value for its price, offering a range of features and specs that rival more expensive laptops.2. *Impressive Performance*: The Intel Celeron N4120 processor and 16GB RAM provide smooth performance for basic tasks, making it ideal for everyday use.3. *Ample Storage*: The combination of 128GB eMMC storage and a 160GB docking station set provides plenty of space for files, documents, and multimedia content.4. *Long Battery Life*: The HP Stream 14" offers up to 14 hours of battery life, making it perfect for on-the-go use.5. *Office 365 Included*: The laptop comes with a 1-year subscription to Office 365, providing access to popular productivity apps like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.*Cons*1. *Limited Upgrade Options*: The laptop's storage and RAM are soldered, making it difficult to upgrade or repair.2. *Basic Graphics*: The Intel UHD Graphics are sufficient for basic tasks but may struggle with demanding graphics-intensive applications.3. *720p Webcam*: The webcam resolution is relatively low, which may affect video conferencing quality.*Verdict*The HP Stream 14" HD BrightView Laptop is an excellent choice for anyone seeking an affordable, reliable device for basic tasks. While it may not excel in demanding tasks or graphics-intensive applications, its impressive performance, ample storage, and long battery life make it a great value for its price.*Rating*: 4.5/5 stars*Recommendation*This laptop is ideal for:- Students seeking an affordable device for schoolwork- Professionals requiring a basic laptop for email, word processing, and browsing- Anyone looking for a reliable, easy-to-use device for everyday tasksHowever, if you're a gamer, graphic designer, or require a laptop for demanding tasks, you may want to consider other options.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Mine just came in yesterday and I have started the process of setting it up today (only 2 days); Iâ€™ve downloaded Google Chrome and a reputable subscription based VPN app (S mode was deactivated for the purpose of downloading Chrome). After downloading those two, I set up 2 administrator users and one standard user. In the process of setting up the other administrator user: the laptop crashed and the screen turned black. Iâ€™ve tried hard resetting and am leaving it to charge overnight. My intended use was for education for when Iâ€™m not at home (I have a desktop and obviously no one is going to bring a whole tower to every class they go to) so I wasnâ€™t planning to use anything fancy â€” word and chrome.In terms of performance before it crashed:1) CPU was at 100% and was still slow when opening up apps (I wasnâ€™t far from my main mesh router and my actual desktop works fine so canâ€™t be internet problem)2) It made me do a recovery startup when I first unpackaged and logged into my microsoft acccount and the startup took about 20 minutes3) Breeze it up â€” it felt warm on the bottom after an hourThinking about returning it if the laptop still doesnâ€™t turn on (Iâ€™ve tried 2 different outlets in 2 different rooms â€” [wall plug] and [my extender that has anker charger and an air purifier plugged in]) tmr afternoon).Edit: Iâ€™m returning it and getting a refund; had it plugged in for a couple of days now and have been attempting to turn it on daily â€” no success; laptop still does not turn on

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Very "cheap" feel to it. Definitely nothing rugged about this and it's not fast at all.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: It won't let me give a 0.5 on the stars, I'd give it a 3.5. I'll echo a few things that others have said. It's not fast. In fact, I got this to replace a YEARS OLD Chromebook. It's only so slightly faster than it. I does take quite a while to do any updates. Last night after about 15 minutes doing yet another update, it was sitting at 0%. After about 30 minutes when I left the house, it was at 12%. The feel of it is very "cheap." Heck, just now, only days old, one of the keys on the keyboard stuck and I could not use the period button. Overall it is functional, but that's about it. The old adage is true, "you get what you pay for." It's a cheap laptop and that's about it.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the laptop to be good value for money and appreciate its screen quality, with one highlighting its stunning 15.6-inch Full HD IPS Display. The device is easy to use and set up, and customers consider it a terrific laptop for their needs. However, the functionality and build quality receive mixed reviews - while some say it works like a gem and is well-made, others report it suddenly stops working and the hinges fall apart. Speed and battery life also show mixed results, with some finding it fast enough for normal use while others say it's slow, and some praising the battery life while others report it doesn't last.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Pretty good laptop. Will make a really good school or low level gaming laptop compared to latest games.It came with a 128gb 800mbps m.2 drive that was slow for windows 11 so upgraded it to 1tb 3500mbps m.2 drive. There are mixed reviews and info even from the manufacturer on if it has a extra ram slot or not but this one does not have one. All the ram is soldered to the motherboard and needs to be taken to an Acer shop in order to upgrade. Out of the box it used 6/8gb of ram at first then after the updates it dropped down to 4/8gb used. The system is pretty fast for only having 4gb free. The processor is the main feature I ordered it for since it is a 4core-8thread processor with speed ranging from 2.5ghz to 4.3ghz. After trying some more power demanding games the temp could still not pass 50c and stays quiet and cool to touch. It normally stays idle around 41c when not under a heavy load with no sound from the fans. The screen is decent quality but not meant for games since it's LCD and not being led the games get a bit of blur here and there with higher fps. Word of advice is when installing a different operating system the WiFi drivers do not reinstall with the system so any online activation is almost useless unless you have a usb-ethernet adapter. The battery lasts me around 6 hours in performance mode but in power saving mode could possibly last 9+ hours and way longer with some power setting tweaks. The graphics says 600mb dedicated and 3400mb shared but unlike a lot of systems all the shared moves straight to dedicated making it 4gb for the graphics. The value is pretty good and the appearance is slick. My older brother was checking it out and thinking of buying one now because of how well it does. Some upgrades to look into if you know what your doing is a new m.2 drive with a faster transfer rate and also possibly an upgraded 15.6inch screen that's 1080p-4k.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Amazed By This Cheap Laptop (1 Month in)
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: If you were like me, looking for a college laptop that would not break the bank, look no further. I am literally writing this review on this laptop in class.I just wanted a (Windows) laptop that I can code on and do a couple assignments while on campus. I never have to worry about the battery dying on me unless it was already really low. It is surprisingly fast but obviously not as fast as a $2000 laptop. Fast enough I would say.Right out of the box, I was instantly very surprised at how good quality everything felt and looked. It is actually pretty large in size but not cumbersome. But as I keep using it I do have some nitpicks about it:- The screen portion is pretty bendable to the point where I feel like you can easily break it. Now I don't know who would do that on purpose but you should watch out.- No backlight on keyboard makes it hard to see keys in low light.- Keyboard feels sort of hollow. Probably because it is cheap.- Fan is noticeably loud, say if the class is quiet. But I do prefer it to be cool and be a little bit loud than it be hot.- Fan ramps up randomly. Like I could have a simple assignment up with 2 tabs open and it could kick on for some reason even though the workload is not much. Then other times I have a bunch of tabs and another application open but it will stay silent.Other than that it is perfect if you need a cheap laptop to get some work done at school or code like me. Definitely recommend.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Neede a laptop with a 10 key. Works well. Have had for a year and hasn't slowed down yet. Great size.  A lil heavy but thats okay. Can't beat the price great value and we'll designed.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Bought this without much confidence and I was very impressed with this machine. Feels very premium and works great. Super fast and the screen is nice and bright with sharp colors. Iâ€™m very happy with my purchase.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Great price, if all you want to do is surf the net
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Overall, very disappointed in this purchase. I should have done more diligence, and read more reviews on YouTube and other sites before buying this particular model laptop (the A 315 24P in the 7320U configuration). It's slow, sometimes freezes up with basic programs, and you can't upgrade RAM, which really hurts. Very misleading descriptions and advertising for this product. There are several similar model options, be very careful when comparing.Pros: Cheap, which is the big selling point here. Easy initial setup, boots quickly, lightweight, display quality is not horrible, decent battery life.Cons: It's slow...like really slow. I get stuck waiting to click on internet links, navigating back and forth between pages, and when using software programs...waiting for the computer to respond, and occasionally having to reboot. This is with plenty of space on the hard drive, also. The fact that you can't upgrade the RAM is really frustrating,the 8gb dual chips are soldered on, no way to change or upgrade.There is no backlit keyboardor touchscreen toggling, despite what the Amazon descriptions might lead you to believe. Sound quality from the onboard (tiny) speakers is horrible, even with my very low expectations for that. Super "tinny" and low volume.Overall, very disappointed. Make sure you read eveything very carefully before purchasing, and research the exact model elsewhere besides Amazon before buying.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This is a great laptop for school or work. It is easy to use with a slim fit and lightweight. I love the ten key number entry on the keyboard. Great design and easy to use.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I was looking for a few things and this laptop had them. Display over USB C, a decent amount of RAM and Storage, low price. Usually you don't get all three. It does come with Windows 11S but it can run full Windows 11 once you take it out of S mode.The only thing I wish it had was a better charger, but it can use USB C to charge so I'm not worried, and a backlit keyboard.

Moreover, the setup process is straightforward, and they consider it good value for money. However, the functionality receives mixed reviews, with some saying it works well while others report it doesn't work from the beginning. Additionally, the laptop's performance is slow, taking forever to load anything.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: HP 14 Laptop (14-dq0040nr) â€“ Affordable and Portable, but with Some Trade-offsâ­ Rating: 4.0/5 â­Pros:âœ… Affordable Price â€“ This HP 14 laptop is budget-friendly, making it a great option for students, light users, or those in need of a secondary device.âœ… Portable & Lightweight â€“ The thin and lightweight design makes it easy to carry around, ideal for on-the-go use.âœ… Decent Display â€“ The 14-inch HD micro-edge display offers clear visuals, though it's not full HD.âœ… Windows 11 Home â€“ Comes with the latest OS, which is optimized for modern applications.âœ… 1-Year Microsoft 365 Subscription â€“ A great addition for users who rely on Word, Excel, and other Office tools.Cons:âŒ Limited Performance â€“ The Intel Celeron N4020 processor is okay for basic tasks like web browsing, email, and document editing, but struggles with multitasking or demanding applications.âŒ Only 4GB RAM â€“ The memory is quite low for modern standards, leading to slower performance when multiple tabs or applications are open.âŒ Minimal Storage (64GB eMMC) â€“ The storage space is extremely limited, meaning you'll need external storage or cloud solutions for larger files.âŒ Not Ideal for Heavy Use â€“ Not recommended for gaming, video editing, or other intensive tasks.âŒ No Backlit Keyboard â€“ Typing in low-light conditions can be challenging.Final Verdict:The HP 14 Laptop (14-dq0040nr) is a solid choice for those needing an affordable, portable device for light tasks like browsing, streaming, and office work. However, its limited RAM and storage make it less suitable for power users or heavy multitaskers. If you need a simple laptop for everyday use and don't mind relying on cloud storage, this could be a good pickâ€”but if you need better performance, consider upgrading to a model with more RAM and SSD storage.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Itâ€™s a computer for $100 give or take. You really can expect only so much out of it. It does the trick. Only issue to me its that itâ€™s a pain in the butt do download google chrome on it, which, I wouldnâ€™t care about using necessarily however apparently a lot of programs online only work with chrome. Not a dealbreaker though. Itâ€™s a little slow but she gets the job done. If you want a computer to blow you away with how great it is, spend some more money and get a better one. productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I got this laptop for use while traveling. Will not use it for demanding software. It's slow. but in the acceptable range. It comes with Windows 11 Home in S mode. S mode limits the software you can use to those available in the Microsoft store. It wouldn't let me use LastPass or Dropbox. It came with Dropbox for S mode, but I couldn't get it to run.I removed S mode - once it's gone it can't be restored - and Dropbox and LastPass ran fine as did Chrome. It took several hours for Dropbox to sync my files, but it did so effectively. Thus, I have access to everything on my hard drive at home. I plugged in a tiny Samsung 256 GB flash drive (it costs $22 on Amazon) into a USB port and now I have far more storage than I'll ever need on this computer. The drive is so small that I'll leave it there for the life of the computer.All the programs I'll need when away from home run on this device. I wouldn't try to use it for gaming, but as a work away-from-home laptop for relatively simple tasks, it does the job at a very affordable price.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Luckily hubby is computer wiz! UPDATE!!!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: WASTE OF MONEY!! Computer went completely black screened in 11 months. Warranty for 1 year.System was completely removed from laptop while doing class work, sent it to Hp and warranty was voided due to the seller modifying the laptop and adding 1TB when itâ€™s only suppose to come with 256gb. Reached out to Amazon and they said I should receive call from seller which I never did. After seeing everyone elseâ€™s reviews Iâ€™m sure I wonâ€™t get anywhere with them and not willing to pay a $200 bs restocking fee! Hubby is a computer wiz luckily (I shouldâ€™ve let him look at it first but wanted to use my warranty).These computers are refurbished, all the parts are from HP EXCEPT for the 1TB Hard drive, which is made from Kingston. Did some research and a 1TB drive is only $60 (I would purchase a different brand than Kingston since itâ€™s the cheapest, you get what you pay for).YouTube how to open and replace the hard drive (easy af)  and do it yourself. But this company seems to make sure these laptops only last but a year which is terrible for people using their last to buy the price of crap , trying to get through school/work etc. Smh. BUYER BEWAREI brought the Samsung 990 Evo Plus 1TB hard drive from Amazon for $70 and paid an extra $12 for a 2 year warranty .. just installed it and re-installed Windows 11 and EVERYTHING was backed up once I signed back in to Microsoft which makes me extremely happy!! DO NOT send your laptop back to this company, they will only sell it again with a weak/used hard drive for $400 to someone elseâ€¦.Itâ€™s cheaper to fix it yourself. :)

The quality and value for money receive mixed reviews, with some finding it good quality for the price while others consider it a waste of money. The battery life and performance receive mixed feedback, with some praising its speed while others find it very slow. Additionally, customers report significant cosmetic damage to the device.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: My Experience with the Lenovo 300e Chromebook (Renewed): A Practical Review
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I picked up this Lenovo 300e Chromebook as a secondary device, something I could toss in my bag for on-the-go tasks without worrying about my more expensive laptop. And honestly? It's been surprisingly useful.Use Cases:The "Coffee Shop Companion":I often find myself wanting to escape the home office and get some work done at a local cafe. This Chromebook is perfect for that. It's lightweight, the battery lasts long enough for a few hours of work, and it's great for writing emails, browsing the web, and even some light document editing.The 2-in-1 design comes in handy when I just want to read an article or watch a quick video while sipping my latte.Travel Buddy:I recently took a short trip, and this Chromebook was ideal. It's small enough to fit easily in my carry-on, and it's great for staying connected, checking flight details, and even watching a movie on the plane.I also let my child use it for some light games, and the touch screen was perfect for that.Kitchen Recipe Reader:I've found myself using this chromebook in the kitchen. The 2 in 1 feature allows it to sit on the counter like a tablet, and display recipes while I cook. I don't have to worry about getting my main laptop dirty.Simple Task Machine:Let's be real, sometimes you just need a device for simple tasks. Checking email, browsing social media, watching YouTube â€“ this Chromebook handles all of that with ease.It's also great for letting the kids use for schoolwork or simple games without worrying about them messing up my main computer.My Personal Take:Yes, it's a renewed device, so there are a few minor scratches. But honestly, for the price, I'm not complaining.It's not a powerhouse, so don't expect to run demanding applications or play high-end games. But for everyday tasks, it's more than adequate.The Chrome OS is simple and intuitive, which is a plus for me. I don't need a lot of bells and whistles. I just want something that works.I have had no charging issues, and the battery life has been acceptable for my needs.Overall:If you're looking for a budget-friendly, portable device for everyday tasks, the Lenovo 300e Chromebook (Renewed) is worth considering. It's not perfect, but it's a solid little machine that gets the job done.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Definitely not "like new" as described, but functional and will do in a pinch
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: ***Update: I amended this review from three stars to one star, because a couple of weeks after I posted this initial review, my computer simply stopped working. It will turn on, but I get a plain black screen. With all the other issues I was having, I simply decided this was not worth the hassle and returned it. I will also note that I didn't mention it in my initial review, but this whole process also included another purchase of the same item that was for some reason flagged as undeliverable during shipping, so I never received that one. It's just become a massive headache that's already worth more than $80 in my time and energy, so I opted to simply return the computer.The return process was easy at least, but I will not be buying refurbished electronics on Amazon again.I'm leaving my original review below for posterity.***I bought this computer advertised in "like new" condition for around $75. I wasn't expecting miracles, but there are a couple things I have an issue with enough to give a 3 star review. They're not a big enough deal to request a refund (again, $75 computer here...I feel like going through the process of requesting a return/replacement is more of hassle), but not great. If this had been advertised for its actual condition, I still might have bought it, but I'd be giving it a much better rating.Biggest one is that in my "like new" computer, the track pad is wonky. It sometimes catches clicked down in a way I can feel if I click too far to the bottom left, and I have yet to be able to successfully highlight anything because the drag is weird. Neither of these are a huge deal for the way I plan to use this computer (especially because the touch screen does work fine so worst case I just highlight by touch), but it's less than I expected based on the listing.The other is that my computer arrived dirty, which I wasn't surprised by as other reviewers have mentioned it, but it was kind of disappointing. I don't think it was anything particularly gross, but there was a goopy smear on one of the device's silver-colored hinges that was rather off-putting, along with a spray of dried droplets on the screen. Probably just grease or oil and the residue of cleaner, but let's just say I cleaned the whole thing thoroughly before I used it.Overall, though, I just needed a really cheap computer to get me through a couple weeks, and this fits the bill. It runs fine other than the trackpad issue, comes with a decent charger, set up easily, all that good stuff. Just, you know, be aware that you're definitely getting what you're paying for!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: BUYER BEWARE OF DELL, AMAZON AND THIRD PARTY SELLERS ON AMAZON!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: BUYER BEWARE OF DELL, AMAZON AND THIRD PARTY SELLERS ON AMAZON.  And extended warranty company Asurion.Amazon's  practice of listing and selling products like Dell computers for third party sellers seems like a scam, since the third party seller can sell old products on Amazon where the warranty is already expired or almost so.  And I saw nothing on AMAZON's site when I bought the DELL computer that things like an expired or limited time warranty could be an issue when buying ON AMAZON from a third party seller.Bought this Dell computer on Amazon, July 16, 2024, and Jan.3, 2025 the screen separated from the cover.  Contacted Dell, and they advised the WARRANTY was EXPIRED!  That's less than 6 months.  Dell said the AMAZON third party seller resold the computer on AMAZON months after it bought the computer, and the warranty began to run earlier when the third party seller bought the computer. Not when I purchased the computer on Amazon!Spent hours on the phone with Dell, and they know about this issue with third party sellers.  Even after providing them with the Amazon invoice and receipt of when I took possession of the computer, they would not help me and apply and run the warranty to the date I bought the computer from Amazon.Amazon's rep basically said sorry, but that's my problem for buying from a third party seller. Say what?  I bought the computer on AMAZON and paid AMAZON.  Now I'm out of luck?To make matters worse, I bought an extended warranty on Amazon from Asurion on the same day I bought the Dell computer on Amazon.  When I tried to make a claim, Asurion auto responded that the Dell computer still has the manufactures warranty and to contact Dell, seemingly as a result of only having purchased the computer from Amazon in July.  And not taking into account that the warranty started to run when the third party seller bought the computer months earlier.Shame on Dell, Amazon, and Asurion.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Pros- upgrades are great value over base model, big FHD non-IPS display with non-glare finish (no more lights reflecting on screen), easy to set up and update, most all software from Win10 machine installed quickly with few exceptions, speed is lightning fast even with multiple programs open, touch pad very responsive, good security with 11 ProBitlocker encryption, very fast 500gb ext SSD drive comes with USB C to A cable plus A to C adapter) & can be Bitlocker enabled, using ethernet to usb adapter gets close to 1g download speed, lightweight vs my Win10 laptop.Description clarifications: not 2025 model came out  Spring 2024 (maybe like cars? info based on available BIOS, driver updates from HP Support), orig key was Win10 Pro (not big deal if cost brought down), no MS Office 365, just trial. Office key (lifetime is redundant since you own it w/no future feature updates) provided thru link incl on card was for Office 2016 (I installed my 2021 Office Pro), screen brightness is 250 nits not 300 (per HP). Not mentioned- no CD/DVD drive, no ethernet port, no SD card slotCons- no backlit keyboard, fan is loud (fortunately comes on infreq tho), heat vent on top near R speaker can be hot to touch but good alt to bottom vents which req fan or raised platform, only 2 USB A ports will prob need a new hub to accommodate all older A inputs incl wireless adapters for mice, keyboard.Summary- can't go wrong at this price point, very happy with impressive speed and value upgrades (get them all, worth it), one star deduction for inaccurate item details esp Win11 Pro license and incl of 365/Office. Hope this review from experienced user helps somebody in their decision. Cheers

(The display on the 15-inch MacBook Air has rounded corners at the top. When measured as a standard rectangular shape, the screen is 15.3 inches diagonally; actual viewable area is less.)
SILENT DESIGN â€” MacBook Air features a fanless design that runs completely silent, no matter the task.

SIMPLY COMPATIBLE â€” With thousands of apps optimized for Apple silicon, all your favorites are lightning fast in macOS, including Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, Adobe Creative Cloud, and Google Workspace. And free software updates keep things running smoothly and securely. (Apps are available on the App Store. Title availability is subject to change.)
ADVANCED CAMERA AND AUDIO â€” Look sharp and sound great with a 1080p FaceTime HD camera and three-mic array. Immerse yourself in movies and music with a six-speaker sound system and Spatial Audio.

MAGIC KEYBOARD WITH TOUCH ID â€” The comfortable-to-use, backlit Magic Keyboard comes with full-height function keys and Touch ID, which gives you a fast, easy, secure way to unlock your Mac and sign in to apps and sites â€” all at the touch of a finger.
VERSATILE CONNECTIVITY â€” MacBook Air features a MagSafe charging port, two Thunderbolt ports, and a headphone jack.
COMES WITH APPLECARE WARRANTY â€” Every Mac comes with a one-year limited warranty and up to 90 days of complimentary technical support. Get AppleCare+ to extend your coverage.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers praise the MacBook Air's speed, noting it charges batteries faster and is responsive. The laptop receives positive feedback for its build quality, functionality, and design, with one customer describing it as a "visual feast." Customers find it easy to use, with multitasking feeling like a breeze, and appreciate its portability as a lightweight powerhouse that's perfect for daily bag use. Customers like the larger 15-inch screen and its impressive resolution.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: MacBook Air M2: Light as a Feather, Powerful as a Hurricane
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: MacBook Air M2: Light as a Feather, Powerful as a HurricaneLet me start by saying this is my inaugural MacBook experience, and boy, did I make the right choice with the MacBook Air M2. The struggle between the Air and the Pro was real, but let me assure you, the Pro would have been sheer overkill for my needs. The Air, on the other hand, is nothing short of a technological masterpiece.Now, let's talk battery life. Picture this: the Energizer Bunny looks at my MacBook Air and says, "Hey, slow down!" The battery life on this thing is not just impressive; it's like a magical well that never runs dry. I'm convinced it runs on fairy dust because it outlasts the longest of workdays, making the concept of charging seem like a distant memory. A full 8-10 hours? Try a battery life that defies the laws of physics.In reality, a full day of building websites, from dawn till dusk, is a walk in the park for this powerhouse. It scoffs at the idea of needing a charge and keeps chugging along like it's powered by pure determination.Now, let's delve into the performance. This laptop is the epitome of versatility. For 98% of users, it's a dream come true. Whether you're juggling multiple tabs, occasional video editing, or tweaking those stunning photographs, the MacBook Air M2 handles it all with grace. And let's not forget the 16GB of RAMâ€”it's the secret sauce that keeps everything running buttery smooth.The build quality is nothing short of exquisite. It's like holding a piece of fine art or a meticulously crafted sculpture. The laptop is so shockingly lightweight; you might forget it's in your bag. Yet, its premium feel assures you that you're cradling a work of technological art.The 15.3-inch screen is a visual feast. Crystal clear, bright, and vibrant with colors that pop like a fireworks display. It's a canvas for your digital endeavors, making every task a joy. This MacBook has handled everything I've thrown at it with ease, and trust me, I've thrown a lot.In conclusion, if you're like me and agonized over the MacBook decision, let me save you some sleepless nights. The MacBook Air M2 is not just a laptop; it's a lifestyle upgrade. It's the perfect balance of power, portability, and sheer delight.Now, let's talk about the leap from Windows to Mac. As a longtime Windows user, the switch was surprisingly smooth. MacOS is a breath of fresh air, with its intuitive design and seamless integration. The learning curve felt more like a gentle slope, and soon enough, I was navigating with the finesse of a seasoned Mac user.The ecosystem harmony is real. My MacBook effortlessly syncs with my iPhone and other Apple devices, creating a unified digital experience that feels like pure magic. So, to my fellow Windows veterans considering the switch, fear not.Yours in MacBook bliss...
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
productPageReviews.variant: Style: 16GB RAM, Capacity: 256GB, Color: Midnight, Set: Without AppleCare+

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: I mean, it's a 15inch MacBook Air - the perfect compromise between weight, power, and screen size.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This computer is pretty much perfect. It's light, it's sleek. Its fast. It's actually made me enjoy using a computer again.I got the midnight color and honestly, fingerprints aren't any worse with this color vs any other color. Yes, they are present, but a quick wipe erases them. And then you've got the best looking computer in the coffee shop. Looking at you, you young professional at the coffee shop. Looking so cool.If you've read any reviews on these computers you'll hear all of them conclude with this:  If you're like 90% of people and use their computer for normal things like checking email, writing, using regular apps, basic movie / music editing. Then this is the best computer for you. Why look anywhere else? The screen is huge. The laptop is light. It looks legit. The keyboard is great. The speakers are reasonable. The FaceTime camera is great.If you're life is editing movies then you probably already know that this M2 processor will do the job for you, but it'll come at a cost. The MacBook Air m2 processor is meant for efficiency, but it's not going to export as fast as a pro m2. In saying that..this processor is so much faster than anything in the past 5 years that even if you're used to having a pro computer, and its a few years old, you'll still find yourself with a very capable machine.I was between this and an iPadPro. I went with this because until apple gets its act together an iPad is still an iPad. Anybody who tells you they use it for their daily driver has done a lot work to learn how to navigate the iPad OS to make it work like a MacBook. If you want something cool to look at pictures, browse the internet, do some writing, maybe some call of duty mobile - then get an iPad. If you want a computer. Get a MacBook Air. If you're a heavy gamer, or do a ton of video editing (like your whole workflow) Then get a MacBook Pro 14 air 16 inch. They are incredible, but not something most people will need. For what it's worth, I do video editing with this M2 machine and for me it works great. I don't mind waiting an extra 10min on an hour long project to export. The experience while I edit is still super smooth, I just need to wait a bit once I'm done to view my finished product.To conclude. If you're 90% of the world. Just get the MacBook Air. If you can - get the 512gb hard drive. They're faster than their 256gb base counterpart. However, if you're upgrading both your hard driver AND the ram. I think I would just go for a 14inch MacBook Pro. The price difference isn't too much and that 120hz refresh rate on the 14inch pros is noice. But, coming from somebody who notices that sort of stuff, you won't miss the refresh rate on the air. Like you would between an iPad Air vs iPad Pro.Ask questions! I've got answers!

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the gaming laptop runs games well and offers good value for money, with amazing graphics that handle demanding games smoothly. The laptop receives mixed feedback about its build quality, with some praising its durability while others note it's built with cheap materials. Customers disagree on the sound quality, with some finding the audio superb while others say it's not loud enough. The laptop's heat management and battery life also receive mixed reviews, with some praising the cooling system while others report it runs hot and the battery doesn't last long.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have become an ASUS user since 2017 when I bought an FX53VD (the ancestor of TUF series) and now, 8 years later, I buy a new TUF. I really like the solid structural design and the robust technical performance of ASUS gaming laptops, after all my senior ASUS laptop has worked 8 years and is still running well now.By the way, I would like to mention that I use this laptop for daily office work only (I donâ€™t play video games). The reason for buying a thick-and-heavy gaming laptop is that since say 2020, the frequency of CPUs has been insanely increased by the manufacturers while the chassis of light-and-thin laptops remains the same substantially: those useless laptops heat up very easily and the cooling fans sound like helicopters. With an ASUS gaming laptop, you can rarely hear the cooling fans running when you only do normal office work, and that is perfect for me who is sensitive to noises. One last tip: uninstall the Armoury Crate (a programmr developed by ASUS to control the power and cooling fans) and install G-Helper instead!

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Doing great so far, i obviously had to upgrade the ram/memory whatever you wanna call it lol i play rust and it functions well graphics are amazing to me, price is decent for a starter laptop for gaming  easy to navigate its actually a really impressive pc, but upgrade the memory capacity and its even better, color is great keyboard lights are cool idk what else to say im old so dont take much to impress me with new tech but id recommend this pc to any one its fast as heck and quite battery is still lacking but i think thats most laptops lol but overall i really dig it  and if you know rust then you know it dont take much to crash your pc so thats a huge win for this pc i put in 2 16gb memory sticks for 36 gb it runs flawlessly. productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Short version - Good PC with performance that punches above its price point, though the reduced price point means some drawbacks in material quality. One star deducted for only a single stick of RAM.Slightly longer version - I purchased this for my son after he went back to home schooling. Between classes or after assignments, it runs a majority of the games that he likes to play like Valorant, Fortnite, and Teardown. The keyboard has adjustable RGB lighting which is neat, but not super important to either of us. It feels like a bog standard laptop keyboard, and that's fine too. Again, it's a budget system.My biggest gripe with this system is the fact that it only comes with one RAM slot populated. With any PC, using only a single channel of memory will cause noticeable performance degradation. I'd stop short of saying that purchasing a second stick of RAM is mandatory since it will boot and run without it, but you're leaving performance on the table without it. I'd just prefer that a product is ready to use on purchase rather than having to bust out the screw drivers and pry tools before I even power of up.Overall, I'd buy it again. We're happy with it.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Junk. 3 months of very little use just doing basic  tasks for work and the fans wont shut off even when sleeping, fan controller does not work or impact the fans, backlit keyboard randomly works when it wants to, and now I have to boot in safe mode otherwise I just get a black screen with a cursor. Have run a few scans to make sure bios or files are not corrupt and everything always comes back "good". :(

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Ok so I bought this for one thing only, and that was to play The Sims 4. Thats it. I play with alot of mods and CC, have over 6,000 downloads in my mods folder, almost every DLC, and my game loads up into live mode within 5 mins or less, and i have storage leftover for more downloads! Graphics are set to ultra in sims, which is the highest capability in settings,  no lagginess or glitching ever, if so its very rear.Downside: volume. Comparing to my Mac Book Air 2019 where i previously played the sims on, this PC has low volume in general, even on 100. Its just not that loud in my opinion. Downside: the battery life but in all fairness i do have alot of downloads. Please be advised when the battery hits 10% you literally have two minutes to charge it or it will shut down immediately mid. Usually with my MacBook 10% battery life would at least last me about 10 to 15 minutes before it dies. Downside: The fan blows hot air while game is running, feels like it may be overheating but nothing too concerning in my opinion. The charger itself, i actually almost burned myself with it because it was so hot. I do use an extension cord to plug it in so im unsure if theres a difference when plugging directly into an outlet, but this is a safety hazard. Overall i would recommend as far as storage and game quality, the downsides arenâ€™t deal breakers in my opinion. But after playing the sims on Mac for 7 years, iâ€™d say this PC is a major upgrade.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2024

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the laptop functional and easy to set up, with a beautiful display and good value for money. The touchscreen receives positive feedback for its responsiveness, and one customer notes it works well in tablet mode. However, the battery life is problematic, with multiple customers reporting it won't hold a charge at all. Moreover, the keyboard functionality is concerning, with several customers reporting keys that stick during first use. Additionally, the build quality receives mixed reviews, with some finding it in excellent condition while others report poor quality.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I am beyond pleased with my purchase. The laptop is more of a "notebook" size. Not an issue for me. I love that I can fold it and use the entire touch screen, makes it easier to take notes. It was clearly a classroom loaner, but it runs well, keeps a battery charge, and is so much fun to use.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: This one has a defective battery charging function - battery won't charge.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Product is garbage.  So annoyed right now.  It's plugged in and running off the power brick, but it is not charging the battery.Edit: So, I ordered another 3190 2-in-1 laptop with a 128 GB SSD, and discovered that the power supply on this first one is defective and won't charge the battery, because I tried the 2nd power supply from the 2nd laptop on it and it charged.  I also discovered that the 64 GB SSD is not upgradeable and you're stuck with only 64 GB of drive space.  I know this, because I bought a low-power 1 TB Patriot SSD to upgrade this laptop, only to find out it's not possible.For the same $99.99 price, go buy the 128 GB version of this laptop so you can install a larger SSD, like I did.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: More computer than advertiized but the battery condition is not the best.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This review is for the Dell Latitude Touch 3190 2-in-1 PC Intel Quad Core up to 2.4Ghz 4GB 64GB SSD .The unexpected, the machine actually has 8gb of RAM, and a 120gb SSD.The machine arrived in short order. The machine looked like a new machine. No marks of any kind. The screen was in perfect condition as well.However, and this is the reason for only getting 4 stars, the battery in the machine was dead on arrival. A dead battery is never a good sign, and sure enough, the battery condition was only about 65% of new. Far lower than the 80%  that is advertised.Other than the battery condition, this is a very nice machine. Having windows 11 installed, the machine should last for many years. Being a Dell, I suspect that the machine will have few issues.If you need a small, fairly well equipped inexpensive laptop, this model is a pretty safe bet IMO. Yes, I would buy again.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This little laptop came in great shape it was immaculate clean. The battery seems to have a 10 hour + life The hinges are strong and tight. Not experiencing any slowdown and it connected right up to my wifi.  Also i am writing this review on it right now.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I bought this laptop for my son forhisjob. He received it today and went to turn it on, only to discover that it was on and in sleep mode. He started getting suspicious when he noticed that there was other accounts already on it and was set up for the original account holder to have remote access.  He was working with his work IT department and they have had to wipe the hard drive completely and install Windows 11. If he hadn't became suspicious and sat up the laptop with any personal information, whoever had the original account would have been able to steal his information and accessed his work information.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I loved the opening greeting of welcome back. All of my info from a PRIOR Asus automatically transferred over, except my Zoom. Just click, let it do it thing, set your preferences. Took a while to charge as I was on it. Email and every thing transferred over. Came with some cool ear buds and of course a charger. Windows 11 pro and Microsoft  office included. I never even turned the TV on! Completed a newsletter, participated in a Microsoft meeting via an email link. Great price with coupon, very light weight. Would need a secure and sturdy laptop bag. Adjusted the screen lighting and background to reduce the glare.  I did not receive a docking station  as advertised  to be included or the card w\adapter. Thanks

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT GET IF YOU WANT TO ONLY HAVE IT FOR 10 WEEKS!
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I honestly loved this laptop at first. It looks nice, itâ€™s smooth, itâ€™s fast, it has a bunch of storage. However after about 9 weeks of only using for school work it started lagging. I would move the cursor and it would lag or go into a different direction. I thought maybe I just needed to wipe off my pad. However 3 days later as Iâ€™m in class the screen went black!! So, I restarted it and again it went black. I turned this thing off 4 times and it just kept going black. But, then after trying to mess around in the setting to factory reset the screen went black and then it kept flashing. I went to the IT guy at my campus and he told me there is nothing that can be done that my drive is shot to get an exchange. Well, news flash to me this ONLY HAS A 30 DAY WARRANTY!!! How can it only be 30 days?!! That should show up before you make your purchase like a separate screen to verify you only have a 30 day warranty!! So, now Iâ€™m without 230$ and a laptop for school. This is coming from a single mother of 4 in nursing school that is not working much hours because of school. So, Iâ€™m SOL!! I hope this manufacture is happy they rip people off.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I bought this laptop and out of the box the HDMI port and all USB ports would not work properly.HDMI could not project onto connected monitor (tried different monitors and cables that worked for other laptops and nothing) and it could not read any USB flash drive or wireless mouse and keyboard.I called HP to address this issue and because the secondary supplier (this seller) made modifications it was not under their warranty.Because that was not clear at the time of purchase I decided to return the computer rather than get it replaced. All told, they took more than $200 from me for a faulty computer that they screwed up by enhancing it and voiding the manufacturer's warranty.And to boot, I bought the protection with it. That didn't protect me from this malfeasance either.Do not buy from secondary suppliers that hide their personal upgrades to the computer, it voids the warranty and they get you with a restocking fee. Buyer beware.I wish I could give a 0 review, because this deserves it. I would NOT recommend you buying this or any modified laptop on Amazon.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The computer was a nice computer however, the description read as if it had the Ethernet port made into the laptop and it did not. They sent a Ethernet adapter with it so technically it did have a Ethernet port but it was an adapter not made into the laptop. An adapter also means it uses one of your USB drives. My job requires the port be made into the computer but even if an adapter would have been okay with my job It didnâ€™t have enough USBâ€™s. I also use a wireless mouse and I use a USB headset so bottom line is adapter wonâ€™t work for me. The worst part of it is they charged me a $160 restocking fee for a computer I sent back because of inaccurate description. So read the description carefully. I did report it to Amazon so hopefully they will change it.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2025

certifiedBy.name: EPEAT
certifiedBy.description: EPEAT addresses the sustainability impacts of electronic products. An EPEAT registered product must meet required criteria and can meet optional criteria. The criteria depend on the type of product and can include energy efficiency, reduction of fluorinated greenhouse gases (F-Gases), and end of life management. Products meeting 50% - 75% optional criteria are â€œSilverâ€ and those meeting more than 75% are â€œGoldâ€.Learn more about this certification

aPlusContent.title: From the manufacturer
aPlusContent.rawText:
From the manufacturer
The video showcases the product in use.The video guides you through product setup.The video compares multiple products.The video shows the product being unpacked.
Previous page
A smarter PC 
The most powerful NPU in a PC delivers mind-boggling levels of AI compute at 45 trillion operations per second. 
Recall instantly 
Searching for a document, email or web page on your PC can be time-consuming. Now you can just describe how you remember something, and Recall will find it, instantly. [2] 
Create with Cocreator 
Everyone has an imagination and an ability to be an artist. Describe or draw your vision with text or image prompts and watch Cocreator generate an interpretation of it. 
Effects that enhance your calls 
Improve lighting and blur distractions in the background during video calls. When presentation matters, turn on Windows Studio Effects. 
Next page
Turbocharged with the new Snapdragon X Series Platform Processor 
Crazy-fast performance 
Turbo charged NPU accelerates Surface Laptop's performance to new heights to empower your creativity and productivity. 
All-day battery life 
Up to 15.5 hours of battery life [6]. The longest battery life on any Surface. [7] 
The ports you need
