aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers praise this laptop's elite CPU and ultra-fast performance, with one noting its butter-smooth 120Hz refresh rate screen. The device features a solid magnesium-aluminum alloy case, accurate colors, and is ideal for travel. Moreover, the battery life is impressive, with one customer mentioning it lasts nearly the whole day, and all peripherals work well. However, opinions on value for money are mixed, with some finding it a great value while others consider it overpriced.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This incredible, beautiful, elegant and productive laptop showcases what Microsoft is truly capable of, and I'm a Linux guy. I bought the big one - 15" screen, 32 gig RAM, elite CPU. It is a powerhouse of a laptop.Now - there is one con, but as time progresses the problem becomes less and less of a problem and that is the ARM architecture vs standard Intel x86/64. Basically, this laptop uses a newer, different CPU architecture, which means that many applications don't work yet (YET!!). Almost everything I threw at this laptop worked out of the box and worked beautifully. There were some older applications that didn't work (SimCity Deluxe for example). But and this is a huge BUT - as time passes more applications are supported (or emulated effectively) and it becomes less and less an issue.With the 1 CON out of the way, let's talk about how amazing this laptop is:Premium feel (shell and keyboard). As good as or even better than a MacBook. Yes, for real.Speakers sound delightful.The 15"-inch sounds like a big laptop but fits perfectly in my backpack and it is still light and small. I mean, unless you are a 5'2" petite tiny person I don't see how this 15" laptop is too big for someone.It is plenty fast for doing all sorts of productivity like writing papers, excel spreadsheeting, music, internet, YouTube etc. Understand this isn't a fancy Chromebook. Operating System / Applications are exceptionally fast. This laptop WILL make you more productive just by opening it. It makes you want to work it's so nice.Battery life is OUTSTANDING. If you aren't glued to this laptop for hours at a time the battery will last DAYS. Literally days.Touchpad is also legit. No problems with cursor moving around (palm detection) and typing. Just legit good.Even when watching movies it doesn't get hot. Temperature is steady and cool. I love ARM.In closing, get this laptop. It's nice. Really nice. Like honestly, the nicest laptop I've ever owned (I've had the ASUS ROG 2024, two Dell XPS 15's, Razer Blades, etc.,)For my fellow nerds in the crowd:VMWare & Vbox do NOT work. Remember that ARM is a RISC architecture and neither products support ARM (yet). Docker Desktop for Windows DOES work on ARM. Also, WSL 2.0 also works just fine.Also, with the advent of cloud, lightweight servers (I run a small cloud on my home network) we don't need powerhouse laptops anymore if you have supporting infra. When I'm on travel I just VPN into my home network and I have all the resources I need. So keep something light and portable to work from :)

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Finally, a proper Macbook Air Competitor
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Years ago, I had the original Surface Laptop, and I loved it. It remains one of my favorite laptops of all time.So before I purchased the Surface Laptop 7, I actually had a 14" 2021 Macbook Pro. It was honestly too much laptop for my needs, but the limited port selection on the Macbook Airs ruled them out for me. Of course, my Macbook Pro was better than the Surface Laptop 7 in many ways - the mini-LED screen is just about the best laptop display you can get, full-stop, whereas the Surface's display is good but not great. The speakers on the Macbook were amazing; the Surface's are quite good but can't compete in that regard.However, I don't regret my purchase for one second because the Surface Laptop 7 is really a Macbook Air competitor, and that is where it shines. I compared the Surface and Macbook Air 13" side by side and came away with the following conclusions:-Screen: I don't do any serious photo editing or graphic design. To me, the Surface screen is slightly better. It gets much brighter than the Air and colors seem more accurate. However, the Air has better black levels. The Surface is a touchscreen, but I never use it as I don't like fingerprints on my screens. However, if you want a touchscreen, the Surface is clearly the better option. The Surface also has a 120hz display, whereas the Air is stuck at 60hz. The difference in smoothness when scrolling or using trackpad gestures is very noticeable. The Surface's screen looks much smoother.-Speakers: I can't tell the difference between the two. The Surface's speakers are really good compared to other laptops in this class. The same is true of the Macbook Air.-Ports: I had hoped that by 2024, USB-A would be all but gone, but alas it is not. It was very annoying to have to carry around dongles to use USB-A devices on my Macbook Pro, and now I don't have to! The Air has only two USB-C ports, so clearly the Surface wins here. The Macbook Pro does have HDMI, which is nice, but I just bought a USB-C to HDMI cable that I carry around with me, so I don't need a dongle for that either.-Keyboard: I like that the Macbook Air has more than 3 levels of brightness control, but I slightly prefer the key feel on the Surface.- Trackpad: somehow, the Surface's trackpad is better. I am thrilled that Microsoft finally brought a haptic trackpad to the Surface lineup. It feels more delicate and the tactility is stronger. Macbook trackpads are still among the best in the business, but there is finally a Windows laptop that is comparable in this regard.-Login: hands down, Windows Hello is better than the fingerprint reader. It's so fast that my Surface often logs me that it feels like the laptop was left unlocked. The fingerprint scanner on Macbooks are very good, but they are not as fast, nor as convenient, as Windows Hello. My Macbook Pro could also unlock with my Apple Watch, but that almost always took longer than unlocking with my finger.-Build Quality: This has always been a strong point for Surface devices, and the Surface Laptop 7 doesn't disappoint. The laptop can be opened easily with one hand, and the fit and finish is flawless. The same is true of the Macbook Air. I can't say whether one is better than the other. The Surface is designed to be easier to service, however, and you can actually replace the SSD, which is very nice. Additionally, the black finish on my Surface is more resistant to showing fingerprints than the dark blue on the Macbook Airs, which is a fingerprint magnet.-Performance: After owning an Apple Silicon laptop, I could never go back to using an x86/x64 processor. I used Windows 11 for ARM on my Macbook for two years virtualized in Paralells, so I knew what I was getting into. All of the applications I need work beautifully on the Surface, and it is so darn fast. Of course, there are more powerful processors out there using traditional x64 architecture, but I have never used a Windows laptop that is just so snappy for every day tasks. Office apps open in 1-2 seconds. Firefox, Chrome, and Edge open in less than a second. Using gestures to swipe through apps is super snappy, and the high refresh rate screen makes transitions look so smooth. This is the kind of performance I came to except from my Apple Silicon Macbook, and it's wonderful to finally see Windows operating just as responsively.Overall, the Surface feels like an upgrade over my Macbook Pro, and I personally am fine with the tradeoffs that come with the thinner, smaller, and lighter Surface over the more powerful Macbook Pro. It is an utterly fantastic laptop that, in my opinion, is currently the best thin-and-light laptop in the world.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: The base version of the Dell Inspiron 15 7501 with integrated components is a competent laptop that would work great for someone looking to move up from a Chromebook, but not ready to leap into the $1K price range.One of the first things that struck me about this laptop is that it has a full size keyboard that includes a number pad. For a 15" this is nice for people who like 101 keys. For me it's a mixed bag. While it's nice to have all of the keys it means the actual letter keys are small. The keyboard is nice to type on and features springy keys.The screen on the base model is, much like the rest of the laptop, competent. It is a bit dim, but it's 1080P so you can watch movies in high resolution. The base model doesn't come with a touch screen, which is fine. I have a laptop with a touchscreen and the only time I use it is when I accidentally move something because I'm trying to wipe a piece of dust off the screen.This model came with 8 gigs of ram, a 512 gig drive, and an i5 processor. It's fast enough for every day use, and you can do some light gaming on it, especially if you play a 2d game. I found that Factorio ran, although slow, but if I was stuck in a hotel room with this, at least I'd be able to play.Battery life over normal use, for instance office, some web, and a few videos puts this on par with other Windows 10 laptops at around 3 or 4 hours with the screen at 60 to 70%. In the case of the 7501 the screen's brightness is low, so you'll have to have the brightness cranked up to compensate.At about $700 this is a good laptop and would serve a college student well.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I had a dell years ago when I was in college for my bachelors degree and I loved it. I have not used it since and I recently (10 years later) decided to go back for my masters. I took out my old dell and unfortunately it had windows vista and did not have the requirements needed to update. I made the dumb decision to go the cheaper route and got an HP. 5 months later and I wised up and got this bad boy. Dell does not disappoint. The keyboard does light up. It is all very user friendly. And I didnâ€™t even realize the screen is touch screen until 2 days later. So that was an added bonus. There is plenty of memory and storage. The display is amazing. The keyboard is just fabulous. The batter life is great. I only have to charge every 3 days or so but I donâ€™t do a whole lot other than school work on it. I donâ€™t know what I was thinking trying anything other than dell. I recommend this laptop. It is worth every penny.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the MacBook Air looks and works like new, offering great value for the price. The functionality receives mixed feedback, with some saying it works decently while others consider it a bad product. The charger compatibility, battery life, ease of setup, and speed also get mixed reviews - while some report good performance, others experience issues with the charger not working, battery not holding charge, setup difficulties, and slow performance.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have a small online business based in graphic design and publishing (I use Canva daily). I use this laptop for work and for casual browsing. Itâ€™s amazing how nicely it works given the price. I have no problems with it. That being said, if someone is a programmer, gamer, or does something else that requires more power than graphic design, book editing/ formatting, or browsing YouTube and reading articles, youâ€™ll probably need a more powerful laptop.I love that itâ€™s lightweight, portable, and has a sleek design as well. People who are in-the-know about Macs can probably tell this is an old model, but I donâ€™t care about that. Itâ€™s aesthetically pleasing and timeless. Also, the accurate on-screen colors that you get with Macs are pretty important for graphic design, and this laptop is fast so long as I donâ€™t have too many tabs open at once. This is perfect for me.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This is my fourth Macbook that I have purchased from this seller ( I have four children). Based on the mixed reviewsâ€¦ I was VERY skeptical ( and to be honest, scared).However, each laptop arrived  in pristine condition : no scratches , easy setup and all around pretty great product.But to be clear this is a product that is no longer supported by Apple.  That means, if you need microsoft products you will not be able to download them.  It also means that most of the App store is inaccessible.  These are things that I really wish I knew beforehand.  i Also wished that the seller updated the computer/downloaded the latest software before shipping. All of these things would have not only been a great customer service move but also made my life a THOUSAND times easier.  All the same if you have even a smidge of technical knowledge this computer will work just fine for you.  And, all four kids are completly happy so I guess... not a total loss.Thanks.

productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewTitle: Excellent item with one minor problem
productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewDescription: Computer packaging was impressive. Although this a 2015 MacBook Air it looks like it just came from the factory. Not a mark or dent on it. It runs perfectly. Why did I give it a 4? When you reach the page in the set-up requiring reading of license and privacy items you canâ€™t continue and can only go back to the page before requiring your name and password. I had to google what to do. Apparently this had happened to quite a few others with this same model. Quick answer is to hit the skip notice near top of the page you go back to. Other than this the computer is a great buy from a reputable seller and I highly recommend it.

json.description: Switching out of S mode in Windows 11 Windows 11 in S mode is designed for security and performance, exclusively running apps from the Microsoft Store. If you want to install an app that isn't available in the Microsoft Store, you'll need to switch out of S mode 1. On your PC running Windows 11 in S mode, open Settings > System > Activation. 2. In the Switch to Windows 11 Pro section, select Go to the Store. (If you also see an "Upgrade your edition of Windows" section, be careful not to click the "Go to the Store" link that appears there.) 3. On the Switch out of S mode (or similar) page that appears in the Microsoft Store, select the Get button. After you see a confirmation message on the page, you'll be able to install apps from outside of the Microsoft Store. aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the laptop's design beautiful and appreciate its portability, being light enough to carry. The setup process is easy to use, and customers consider it great for college use. The functionality, speed, and value for money receive mixed reviews - while some say it works well and starts up fast, others report it stops working for no reason and isn't worth the price. Battery life is also mixed, with some praising its exceptional performance while others report it won't hold a charge.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Not a powerhouse, but if you need a portable laptop with great battery life, this can't be beat. Sure, discontinued, but for the price, a total no-brainer. And, it will run W11. Comes with the lame locked W11 S version which is barely functional, just search how to unlock it, easy, and you then get a full W11. I use this for meetings, does PPT, email, PDFs, etc. just fine and over a VPN. I even bought another one to donate to the local kid Lego League robotics program.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Keep getting pop up message that is totally distracting
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I keep getting this pop up message: Because you're accessing sensitive info, you need to verify your password. And it's greatly interfering with my work. If this isn't fixed by tomorrow, I am returning this laptop. I am not contacting customer support wasting my time. The sellers should be monitoring the reviews and they should be fixing this issue on their end which I know they are very aware of it because the issue has been reported all over the internet in various forums. I am very upset they sold me a computer with this horrible glitch.Update*** still have the same problem, along with other problems as well. This laptop is a nightmare to do my work and school work on. I am going to list problems as I go along. One of many major problems I have is that you can barely find a black space to let the mouse rest while you work without it pulling down a drop down menu. I am so sick of these menus appearing any and everywhere.Next major problem is, if you go back to delete something you've written, which is what humas do many times, the backspace and cursor jump somewhere else which makes you have to wase time, your blood pressure rises because it makes no sense of why this happens. Every single time I have to delete something I've written it becomes a major problem.Another major problem, when you are sitting down and the laptop is resting on your lap, EVERY SINGLE TIME you get up from a seated position, moving your laptop, the mouse mechanism clicks itself so your browser closes out or your mouse clicks on something and you lose where your at or wind up sending something you didn't mean to which is A BIG NO NO.I REALLY, REALLY, REALLY DISKLIKE THIS LAPTOP. HORRIBLE!I feel very badly for kids whose parents make them use this laptop. I can only imagine the poor kids losing their work or their work getting messed up through NO fault of their own but they don't know how to convey that to the parents so it winds up being the kids fault according to the parents. I already know how many arguments this laptop has caused families.There is NO reason in this day in age for a laptop to be this horrible. As I am typing now, my cursor jumps everywhere and I had to restart what I'm writing 10 different times already in the last 5 minutes. I wish I could give this laptop negative stars!!!! I wouldn't take this laptop if it were for free!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Not enough storage for basic use
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have learned from my ignorance. When you buy a cheap computer you get no storage space. I bought this computer to use for school but it has very little storage space. The other day I couldn't open Excel because it said it didn't have enough room. When you're in business school you need Excel. I feel like I'm back in the days when phones only had 16 GB and I'm constantly having to delete stuff just to use my phone but now it's my computer. I have very little on this computer but yet it's constantly telling me it's too full. If I did it again I wouldn't buy it I would spend the money to get more storage.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the MacBook Air's quality excellent, noting it looks brand new and works well, with one mentioning it performs everything they need with ease. The laptop receives positive feedback for its speed, being more efficient than Windows-based systems, and customers consider it worth the price. The battery life and charger compatibility receive mixed reviews - while some praise the battery life, others report issues with the battery not holding a charge, and several customers mention the laptop only turns on when plugged in.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Got this for school, as I was in the market for a laptop so I could do work on the go, as I just have my desktop, and my iPad isnâ€™t ideal. I didnâ€™t wanna spend a ton of money, and so I got this. Yes, it had a scratch on the back, but I have a cover on the front and back, and you wouldnâ€™t even know it was used. Setup was easy and the only thing that took forever was updating it to the available iOS but other than that, it works great! I would recommend if you want a MacBook without breaking the bank and donâ€™t mind not having something new!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Hello everyone, I hope this message finds you well. So as I was looking through the reviews, I noticed people were saying that theyâ€™re not able to sign in with their Apple ID.A fix for this issue is that you will need to update your Mac to MacOS Monterey because the latest MacOS version doesnâ€™t come installed.You would need to get this update from the Apple website or Google it â€œ MacOS Monterey updateâ€ Once the update is completed youâ€™ll be able to sign in into your Apple ID and youâ€™ll also be able to download any applications that you may need from the AppStore.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I ordered one and the entire two bottom rows of keys stuck, would click like there was sand under the keyboard, or wouldnâ€™t pop back up so my sentence looked like thisâ€œMmmmmmmmy nnnnew laptop  Is unnnnnnnnusabbbleâ€So I reached out to Amazon support who processed a replacement. Unfortunately the replacement was also unusable because the charging port would not hold the charger in it. So unless I wanted to sit there and hold the charger for 2 hours to charge it I had to return that one too. So I reached out to support again and processed that return.I ordered a third one hoping the third time would be the charm but alas, it was not. This one has a battery life of about 18 minutes from full charge until itâ€™s dead. I understand these are refurbished but I have some major concerns about quality control at this point as it doesnâ€™t seem like random bad luck that Iâ€™d get 3 laptops with major problems.Also adding that these are listed in excellent condition however there are also significant cosmetic issues as well. Scratches, deep dents, bent corners. Not something Iâ€™d look at and say â€œyeah this is in excellent conditionâ€. I hope the seller takes more care in refurbishing these in the future because it feels like they are just out here taking in a computer, restoring it to factory settings and listing it for sale. No way they could do even a cursory check of these and not notice 20 sticky keys or the inability to charge a computer.This process has taken me about 3 weeks from placing my first order and has been a headache all around. I wouldnâ€™t recommend these unless you are fully aware that youâ€™ll need to dedicate time and money to making the computer you receive able to be used.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: FOR $250 this is the bargain you cannot pass up!!!!Here's the meat and potatoes of it ...The Macbook Air which i purchased has the Apple quality i have gotten to know and love over the past 20 years of being an Apple Product User as the devices became more compact  over the last 15 of those 20 Years i have purchased iMacs (2006, 2009, 2 iPhones ( 4,5,6,7,10, 11Pro, 14 Pro, 16 Pro) the Macbook ( yes the white one i started buying those when they came out around 2006/2007) and the Macbook Pro ( 2008-2017) and i have had the iPod Shuffle, iPod Touch ( 2011,2012, 2013, 2014) so i know the quality that these  devices posssess as i am " not new to this" i just love love love the Apple Products and alll of the diffrent computers and phones they have at first they kind of are basic but as the years go by they evolvenow onto the particular review of this product which is a 2017 13-Inch Macbook Air- it is refurbished and it was about 7 years old when i got itThe Pros are that i updated it to the MacOSx from 2021 which is i believe the last Mac OSx it can be updated to for this model and it works great - the MAcbook is a  CORE i5 Model but to tell you the truth when i use a MAc Computer they are innately more faster anyways so i dont get too cuaught up in buying the fanciest most spec'd out models i usually opt for teh "mid-range" however this time my MacBook Pro from 2017 went out on me and i just needed something since i travel a lot i value portable and compact devicesPLUS I WANTED SOMETHING THAT STILL HAD THE  USB 2.0/ 3.0  PORTS (non USB C) AND HAD A HEADPHONE JACK ( I THINK ITS DUMB TO HAVE A COMPUTER WITHOUT A HEADPHONE JACK) so i got this and do not regret itLET ME TELL YOU THIS IS MY FiRST MACBOOK AIR - I REMEMBER THINKING " CAN I REALLY GO FROM A MACBOOK PRO TO AN AIR- DONT THE AIR MODELS HAVE LESS LIKE SPEED AND STORAGE?"  NEEDLESS TO SAY I GOT THIS AND I FELL IN LOVE- ITS LIGHTER AND THINNER - i may never go back to a MacBook Pro again who knowsNow the only con i can think of ( besides the DENTS and theres a few of them like  is the fact that the computer doesnt have the latest and greatest but thats all-right with me the DECREASED BATTERY  on this ( oh the other con) is not the best like i will charge it to 100% and then the comouter will shut dowjn at like 48 percent or something i will get maybe like FOUR HOURS of BATTERY LIFE  on this there have been times when i have gotten six hours out of itTHE SPEEDJust to put it in persepctive than i use this computer for about five hours each day and turning itn on the time from boot up to login to being on the internet is ONE MINUTE yes exactly SIXTY SECONDS the Core i5 Processor is absolutely a beast this thing is just of the charts in terms of its amazing capability - i can watch movies and there is no lag when it comes to streaming , stream songs and just really ZOOM THROUGH EVERYTHING LIGHTNING FASTPORTABILITYTHIS PARTICULAR MACBOOK AIR IS LIGHTWEIGHT- the computer in all fairness does a slight heftiness to it however that is  nothign compared to the MacBook Pro the 2017 Version i had which felt to be about 4 Pounds i dont know if it actualy was or not i know this thing feels to be ablout a pound maybe one and a half pounds anyways you can throw this beast into your backpack without it weighing you downSD CARD READERYES THIS COMPUTER ( MACBOOK AIR 2017) has a SD CARD READER which is good for a full-size SD Card- the SD Card is very handy for digital cameras - in fact i have a basic yet affordable KODAK EASYSHARE from 2011 which still works perfectly and the SD Card REader on this device makes for an excellent comapnion to that - the data in and output on here is just BLAZING FAST READ/ WRITE there's nothing like it and if the built in SD Reader doesnt work then i have several USB Card Readers which do the trickHeatthe HEAT LEVEL on this laptop is moderate with for the most part the computer doesnt overheat however during times of charging or heavy use ( running more than a applications at once) i havent felt this thing get hot and a remedy to this would be to close a couple apps and then after whcih it works fine with no further heat level issuesSOUND QUALITYthe MacBook Air 2017 COre i5 Model that i have here has interanl speakers that when i compare it to my iMac ( my 2009 which is going strong - my kids seem to like it and havent complained) then the sound quality of these internal speakers is sloightly lower- i feel like the speakers on this device are " on the bottom" whereas the iMac the speakers are on the backside closer to where the USB Ports- overall this in terms of the speakers and the quality you ghet from the speakers on this thing is 9/10DRUABILITy and overall impressionsTHE MacBook aIr is nowadays the "entry level"" Mac- really the Mac MINI is but the MacBook AIr is an entry-level laptop however it is exceeding that "entry-;level'  the computer is fast, light, packable and the fact that it a 13.3 Display compared to the 11.6 Inch Models that were around during the 2014 Year then this is a wider palm rest area which makes way fro more comfortable computing especailly when typing long manuscripts, or even typing in general. The Backlit Keyboard adds that nice touch to the Apparatus and also is vbery handy at nught however it should be noted that having the Backlit Keyboard, utilizing it then you are consuming more battery so try to only use the backlit keyboard if you are in a darkened space. The Webcam on here is very nicely functional and is great for Zoom Meetings or Facetime calls with the Internal Microphone proving to be very rich and the other person can hear you very well. the charge tike for this device is between one to tow houras with the standby time being anywhere from8 Hiurs to 100 Hours just make sure before you put the computer to sleep to TURN OFF WI-FI and Bluetooth as well as closeout any applications you are not using via Activity Monitor. in addition to this as a ruke of thumb- turning down the brightness on your devices can extend battery life greatly

I received the laptop in January and it worked well for 40 days. The battery died and the device started having problems with the wifi connection.Sending the device back cost me $50.It's been more than 10 days since I returned the device and I haven't heard back yet. A disgrace!

productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewTitle: Be prepared to do some work YOURSELF
productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewDescription: All in all, awesome value for money. Great product in good shape and very cheap for a renewed Macbook Air. However, when it came to me in the mail, I had to clean it myself and I had to call Apple Support to help me get into the computer and delete the previous user off the Macbook. When it arrived, the previous user was still LOGGED IN and I couldn't do ANYTHING with the Macbook without his password. Luckily I have some computer literacy and Apple Support helped me wipe his user profile, update the computer and return it to factory settings. Oh, and I also had to CLEAN the physical computer because the keyboard had some gross stuff on it (not too bad though, not a biohazard or anything!).Basically, tl;dr, if you are prepared to do some work yourself and maybe make a phone call to Apple Support, heck yeah this is a great product for great value! If you don't know much about computers and you hate calling tech support... maybe pass on this deal, another one will come around.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Good, but needed a LOT of updates to be current and secure...
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Overall this is a decent, value oriented basic laptop. It will perform most of the stuff a student needs with a very simple version of MS Office. But at this price, please realize that it isn't built for games. (That may be a good thing if you want your kid to get their assignments finished on time ;0) To save some ca$h, I bought the "Used - Like New" version. The laptop I received probably had an older â€œgeneric imageâ€ of software reloaded for resale. As such, it required a couple yearsâ€™ worth of Windows 11 updates, which can be frustrating. After a few failed attempts including one infamous Microsoft BSOD, I finally got the thing running reliably stable. But that took quite some time researching and downloading additional "update repair" software readily available at Microsoftâ€™s websites after following advice from user forums. In my experience this is not unusual with MS. Their products have to work on many different brands of machines, which is not an easy thing to achieve. If you want a sturdy metal frame â€œgood to go right out of the boxâ€ machine, buy a refurbed, slightly older Apple laptop for a little bit more. Iâ€™ve had several of those too. Apple has tight controls on both their hardware and software products. They work well and last a long timeâ€¦ As they say, â€œYou pay for what you get!â€

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Do not make the grave mistake of buying this absolute piece of trash. It is horrible. I know what your thinking. "Wow those are great specs for so cheap". Yeah the old adage "you get what you pay for" applies here. Massively.It is SO slow. May as well have 1g of ram. No setting optimization fixes this. NOTHING works properly. Everything is so buggy and crashes often. I bought this to run quickbooks for a business and my 85 year old book keeper was making fun of me for how slow it was and how I shouldn't have cheaped out and bought this POS.Yeah imagine an 80+ yr old man complaining about how slow a "new" computer is. It's that bad and worse.The screen is literally the worst screen I've ever seen in real life. Laptops 10+ years older have a screen that blows this away. It actually hurts my eyes after about 30 minutes and that's never happened to me before. It is so hard to look at.The whole thing is SUPER cheap. The keyboard layout is stupid and if you're used to a normal keyboard get ready to hit the wrong keys constantly.There is no redeeming quality to this laptop. It's absolutely garbage DO NOT BUY. It's probably not even worth the aggravation trying to get everything off of it and return, so the best I can hope for is some good karma put out in the universe saving some other poor souls the misfortune of buying this POS.Do not buy. You're welcome.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: The Bad Reviews Are Accurate, But Hereâ€™s Why Itâ€™s Okay To Buy It Anyway:
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: CONTEXTI read many of the reviews before deciding to make my purchase. It was in my hopes that the reviews complaining about the computerâ€™s slowness, bad screen quality, Windows S mode, etc. were wrong. I was hoping maybe those people had just gotten defective laptops. Wishful thinking. I didnâ€™t want to spend more than $300-$400 on a laptop and this one advertised that it could do the simple things I need it to do, so I took the risk. Hereâ€™s what I think:THE REVIEWThe computer is slow. Its ram is not very high, so that makes sense. The screen quality is not good, either. And, yes, the computer *does* come in Windows S mode. These are my three biggest complaints, and hereâ€™s what Iâ€™ve done to remedy it:Windows S Mode - I saw another review on here that states that you canâ€™t remove Windows S mode without contacting support. This isnâ€™t true at all. I removed mine easily. You just need to make sure you have your windows login credentials on hand, make sure to pay attention to what youâ€™re clicking & agreeing to (Windows will try to trick you into keeping S Mode enabled), but if you just follow the prompts, itâ€™s super easy to remove it on your own. Just have patience and vigilance.Screen Quality - Iâ€™m not sure if this is the case for every version of this laptop, but mine came with completely messed up settings for color calibration. I noticed when I was using Google Sheets, and pastel green looked like dark blue. This is easy to solve! Look up a YouTube video for how to correct your color calibration for Windows 11. I promise you, itâ€™s easy, and it only took me like 5 minutes. Is the screen quality itself great? No. Will it get the job done at least? Yes, and thatâ€™s all I need from it.Slowness - You get what you pay for. This computer suits my needs, as I am a part-time office administrator, and a fantasy novelist. The slowness is annoying, but all it requires is patience. Just. Wait. Itâ€™s slow to set-up initially, and loading pages in your browser takes more than a blink of an eye, but it DOES get there. If you canâ€™t afford patience, then you should cop up the extra money for a faster computer - OR, buy more ram. This is definitely a laptop that has potential for tech gurus.Final Thoughts:This laptop sucks lol, but for the simple things I need it to do (google docs, google sheets, youtube, word press, data entry programs, so on), it can manage. I would not use it for gaming, programming, etc.We donâ€™t *live* on our computers, people. If you donâ€™t wanna cough up the money for a better computer, learn to be okay with what this one has to offer.

aPlusContent.title: Product Description
aPlusContent.rawText:
Product Description
Unleash Your Productivity with the HP 14" Ultra Light Laptop 
Experience seamless performance and portability with this lightweight laptop, designed for everyday multitasking and productivity on the go. 
Lightweight Laptop 
Unleash Your Productivity 
Experience seamless performance and portability with the HP 14" Ultra Light Laptop. Powered by an Intel Celeron N4120 processor, this laptop delivers reliable computing for your daily tasks. Stay productive on-the-go with its long battery life and fast-charge technology. 
Lightweight Laptop for Students & Home 
HP 14" Ultra Light Laptop for Student & Home 
The HP 14" Ultra Light Laptop is designed for everyday multitasking, with a lightweight and fast processing configuration. It features Windows 11 Home in S mode for a secure and efficient experience. 
Office 365 Features 
Unlock Productivity with Office 365 
Boost your creativity and streamline your workflow with the powerful suite of tools in Microsoft Office 365. This laptop comes with a one-year subscription, giving you access to Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and more, all designed to enhance your productivity and bring your ideas to life. 
Built-in Microphone 
Capture Every Moment with Clarity 
Experience crystal-clear audio with the built-in microphone on this laptop. Whether you're participating in online meetings, recording podcasts, or capturing audio notes, the microphone ensures your voice is captured with exceptional clarity and precision. 
1 x 3.1 Gen 1 Type-C (Data Transfer Only, 5 Gb/s signaling rate) 2 x USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-A (Data Transfer Only) 1 x HDMI 1.4 1 x multi-format SD media card reader 1 x Headphone / mic combo AC smart pin 
Technical Specifications 
Processor 	Intel Celeron N4120 (4 cores 4 threads, base clock speed 1.1GHz, max turbo to 2.6GHz, 4MB L3 Cache)

Graphics 	Integrated Intel UHD Graphics

Weight 	3.24 lbs

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Built Like a Sleeper, Runs Like a Beast
productPageReviews.reviewDescription:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    Yo, donâ€™t let this clean, space grey shell fool youâ€”itâ€™s got some fire under the hood. I cracked this thing open straight out the box and was met with a buttery-smooth setup. The 12th-gen Intel i5-12450H? That chip donâ€™t play. Multitasking is a joke to this machineâ€”I had Chrome tabs battling Spotify, Photoshop, and Zoom, and it didnâ€™t even flinch. The fans stay hush-hush too, so no jet engine vibes when youâ€™re just trying to work or stream.Battery life on this thing is straight-up disrespectfulâ€”in a good way. I unplugged it at 8 a.m., did emails, video calls, and even a little Netflix during lunch, and it was still pushing by the evening. The 62.7Wh battery is no slouch. Plus, the lightweight feel makes it perfect for tossing in my backpack. Whether Iâ€™m chillinâ€™ at a cafÃ© or couch-hopping around the house, I ainâ€™t scrambling for a charger.Whoever designed the port setup knew what they were doingâ€”USB 3.2, HDMI, Type-C, headphone jack, even a micro TF slot. Itâ€™s like they handed me a buffet of options. And that display? Real estate for days. The thin bezels give it that high-end look, and the 1080p IPS panel is crisp enough to make spreadsheets feel like an art form. I even hooked it up to my 4K monitor and it didnâ€™t blink.I peeped the benchmark they threw in with that Intel chip lineupâ€”yo, this i5-12450H smoked some older i7s and even took a jab at Ryzen 5. Real-world use backs it up. Whether Iâ€™m editing content or running code, the systemâ€™s quick to respond and rarely hiccups. Add in that 16GB RAM and 512GB SSD combo, and Iâ€™m flying through tasks like I got cheat codes on.This ainâ€™t just a budget banger, itâ€™s a sleeper build in disguise. Perfect for folks who need performance but donâ€™t wanna flex a glowing RGB brick. Quiet power, smart design, and no nonsenseâ€”exactly how I like it.

json.title: Apple 2023 MacBook Air Laptop with M2 chip: 15.3-inch Liquid Retina Display, 16GB Unified Memory, 256GB SSD Storage, 1080p FaceTime HD Camera, Touch ID. Works with iPhone/iPad; Midnight
json.inStockText: In Stock  Only 8 left in stock - order soon.
features: IMPRESSIVELY BIG, IMPOSSIBLY THIN â€” The 15.3 - inch MacBook Air makes room for more of what you love with a spacious Liquid Retina display. The durable 100 percent recycled aluminum enclosure is strikingly thin and light.
SUPERCHARGED BY M2 â€” Get more done faster with a powerful 8-core CPU, 10-core GPU, and up to 24GB of unified memory.
UP TO 18 HOURS OF BATTERY LIFE â€” Go all day with the power-efficient performance of the Apple M2 chip. (Battery life varies by use and configuration. See apple.com/batteries for more information.)

SPACIOUS, BEAUTIFUL DISPLAY â€” The high-resolution, 15.3-inch Liquid Retina display features 500 nits of brightness, P3 wide color, and support for one billion colors for vibrant images and incredible detail. (The display on the 15-inch MacBook Air has rounded corners at the top. When measured as a standard rectangular shape, the screen is 15.3 inches diagonally; actual viewable area is less.)
SILENT DESIGN â€” MacBook Air features a fanless design that runs completely silent, no matter the task.

SIMPLY COMPATIBLE â€” With thousands of apps optimized for Apple silicon, all your favorites are lightning fast in macOS, including Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, Adobe Creative Cloud, and Google Workspace. And free software updates keep things running smoothly and securely. (Apps are available on the App Store. Title availability is subject to change.)
ADVANCED CAMERA AND AUDIO â€” Look sharp and sound great with a 1080p FaceTime HD camera and three-mic array. Immerse yourself in movies and music with a six-speaker sound system and Spatial Audio.
VERSATILE CONNECTIVITY â€” MacBook Air features a MagSafe charging port, two Thunderbolt ports, and a headphone jack.
COMES WITH APPLECARE WARRANTY â€” Every Mac comes with a one-year limited warranty and up to 90 days of complimentary technical support. Get AppleCare+ to extend your coverage.

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers praise the MacBook Air's speed, noting it charges batteries faster and is responsive. The laptop receives positive feedback for its build quality, functionality, and design, with one customer describing it as a "visual feast." Customers find it easy to use, with multitasking feeling like a breeze, and appreciate its portability as a lightweight powerhouse that's perfect for daily bag use. Customers like the larger 15-inch screen and its impressive resolution.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: MacBook Air M2: Light as a Feather, Powerful as a Hurricane
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: MacBook Air M2: Light as a Feather, Powerful as a HurricaneLet me start by saying this is my inaugural MacBook experience, and boy, did I make the right choice with the MacBook Air M2. The struggle between the Air and the Pro was real, but let me assure you, the Pro would have been sheer overkill for my needs. The Air, on the other hand, is nothing short of a technological masterpiece.Now, let's talk battery life. Picture this: the Energizer Bunny looks at my MacBook Air and says, "Hey, slow down!" The battery life on this thing is not just impressive; it's like a magical well that never runs dry. I'm convinced it runs on fairy dust because it outlasts the longest of workdays, making the concept of charging seem like a distant memory. A full 8-10 hours? Try a battery life that defies the laws of physics.In reality, a full day of building websites, from dawn till dusk, is a walk in the park for this powerhouse. It scoffs at the idea of needing a charge and keeps chugging along like it's powered by pure determination.Now, let's delve into the performance. This laptop is the epitome of versatility. For 98% of users, it's a dream come true. Whether you're juggling multiple tabs, occasional video editing, or tweaking those stunning photographs, the MacBook Air M2 handles it all with grace. And let's not forget the 16GB of RAMâ€”it's the secret sauce that keeps everything running buttery smooth.The build quality is nothing short of exquisite. It's like holding a piece of fine art or a meticulously crafted sculpture. The laptop is so shockingly lightweight; you might forget it's in your bag. Yet, its premium feel assures you that you're cradling a work of technological art.The 15.3-inch screen is a visual feast. Crystal clear, bright, and vibrant with colors that pop like a fireworks display. It's a canvas for your digital endeavors, making every task a joy. This MacBook has handled everything I've thrown at it with ease, and trust me, I've thrown a lot.In conclusion, if you're like me and agonized over the MacBook decision, let me save you some sleepless nights. The MacBook Air M2 is not just a laptop; it's a lifestyle upgrade. It's the perfect balance of power, portability, and sheer delight.Now, let's talk about the leap from Windows to Mac. As a longtime Windows user, the switch was surprisingly smooth. MacOS is a breath of fresh air, with its intuitive design and seamless integration. The learning curve felt more like a gentle slope, and soon enough, I was navigating with the finesse of a seasoned Mac user.The ecosystem harmony is real. My MacBook effortlessly syncs with my iPhone and other Apple devices, creating a unified digital experience that feels like pure magic. So, to my fellow Windows veterans considering the switch, fear not.Yours in MacBook bliss...
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
productPageReviews.variant: Style: 16GB RAM, Capacity: 256GB, Color: Midnight, Set: Without AppleCare+

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: I mean, it's a 15inch MacBook Air - the perfect compromise between weight, power, and screen size.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This computer is pretty much perfect. It's light, it's sleek. Its fast. It's actually made me enjoy using a computer again.I got the midnight color and honestly, fingerprints aren't any worse with this color vs any other color. Yes, they are present, but a quick wipe erases them. And then you've got the best looking computer in the coffee shop. Looking at you, you young professional at the coffee shop. Looking so cool.If you've read any reviews on these computers you'll hear all of them conclude with this:  If you're like 90% of people and use their computer for normal things like checking email, writing, using regular apps, basic movie / music editing. Then this is the best computer for you. Why look anywhere else? The screen is huge. The laptop is light. It looks legit. The keyboard is great. The speakers are reasonable. The FaceTime camera is great.If you're life is editing movies then you probably already know that this M2 processor will do the job for you, but it'll come at a cost. The MacBook Air m2 processor is meant for efficiency, but it's not going to export as fast as a pro m2. In saying that..this processor is so much faster than anything in the past 5 years that even if you're used to having a pro computer, and its a few years old, you'll still find yourself with a very capable machine.I was between this and an iPadPro. I went with this because until apple gets its act together an iPad is still an iPad. Anybody who tells you they use it for their daily driver has done a lot work to learn how to navigate the iPad OS to make it work like a MacBook. If you want something cool to look at pictures, browse the internet, do some writing, maybe some call of duty mobile - then get an iPad. If you want a computer. Get a MacBook Air. If you're a heavy gamer, or do a ton of video editing (like your whole workflow) Then get a MacBook Pro 14 air 16 inch. They are incredible, but not something most people will need. For what it's worth, I do video editing with this M2 machine and for me it works great. I don't mind waiting an extra 10min on an hour long project to export. The experience while I edit is still super smooth, I just need to wait a bit once I'm done to view my finished product.To conclude. If you're 90% of the world. Just get the MacBook Air. If you can - get the 512gb hard drive. They're faster than their 256gb base counterpart. However, if you're upgrading both your hard driver AND the ram. I think I would just go for a 14inch MacBook Pro. The price difference isn't too much and that 120hz refresh rate on the 14inch pros is noice. But, coming from somebody who notices that sort of stuff, you won't miss the refresh rate on the air. Like you would between an iPad Air vs iPad Pro.Ask questions! I've got answers!

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find this laptop to be a solid choice for everyday tasks, appreciating its super fast performance that handles multitasking efficiently. The 16-inch IPS FHD display delivers razor-sharp clarity, and the 360-degree touchscreen is particularly handy. Customers consider it an affordable hybrid laptop for work and entertainment, with easy setup and good functionality for students and work tasks. They like the battery life, with one customer reporting 10+ hours of use.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I recently purchased this Laptop and I am absolutely thrilled with its performance! From the moment I unboxed it, I was impressed by the sleek design and premium feel. The build quality is fantasticâ€”lightweight yet durable, making it easy to carry around without compromising on sturdiness. The matte finish is not only stylish but also resistant to fingerprints, which is a nice touch.The display is nothing short of stunning. The vibrant colors, crisp resolution, and wide viewing angles make watching movies and editing photos an absolute pleasure. Whether youâ€™re indoors or outside, the screen remains bright and clear, which is perfect for all sorts of environments. I also appreciate the anti-glare feature, which makes long hours of work much more comfortable.In terms of performance, this laptop has been a powerhouse. Powered by a latest-generation Intel processor and backed by 16GB of RAM, it handles multitasking with ease. Running multiple applications simultaneously, from productivity software to creative tools like Photoshop, doesnâ€™t slow it down at all. Iâ€™ve also tried gaming on it, and the integrated graphics provide an enjoyable experience with smooth frame rates and minimal lag.The battery life is another highlight. On a full charge, Iâ€™m able to get around 10+ hours of use, which is perfect for those long days of work or travel. Whether Iâ€™m working from a cafÃ© or attending back-to-back meetings, I never have to worry about running out of juice before I can find an outlet. Additionally, the laptop charges quickly, so you can spend less time plugged in and more time being productive.Another standout feature is the keyboard. Itâ€™s extremely responsive, with just the right amount of travel for a comfortable typing experience. Iâ€™ve typed countless documents and emails, and my hands donâ€™t get fatigued like they used to with other laptops. The backlit keys are also a thoughtful touch for working in dimly lit rooms or during late-night sessions.The laptopâ€™s speakers have surprised me with their quality. For a device of this size, the sound is clear, rich, and surprisingly loud. Itâ€™s perfect for watching movies or listening to music without needing external speakers.This in-1 Laptop giving me flexibility for any task. With a 360Â° rotating hinge, easily switch between modes for work, entertainment, or presentations, making it Ideal for on-the-go use. Also it features a fingerprint scanner for secure, password-free login. It enhances security by ensuring only authorized users can access the device with a quick, touch-based authentication methodAll in all, this laptop has exceeded my expectations in every category. Whether youâ€™re using it for work, entertainment, or creative endeavors, it delivers top-tier performance and design. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality, reliable, and versatile laptop. Itâ€™s definitely worth every penny!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I have not used 2-in-1 laptop for about 10 years, and I was not expecting the new designed 2-in-1 laptop can be this good! I started to search a new laptop because I wanted to find a new device that is equipped with a larger touchscreen for my son's online class, and I am super glad that I found it. My son can make it tablet mode by himself super easily and he had been enjoying a lot to use this giant touchscreen for his online math class. He can draw and make note with his hand smoothly! When he is not using it for online class, I have been using it for work as well. The 16gb RAM ensures the laptop runs smoothly for all of the daily app/software that I use. This laptop is equipped with two hard drives with a total of 640GB, which is plenty of storage for photos, documents and videos. However, if I want, I can easily upgrade to a larger SSD because there is an access in the back of the laptop where I can swap a new SSD in a few minutes. This is a great and thoughtful design! Since the screen is 16inch and 1080P resolution, I had been enjoying to watch video and movie on it. There are also lots of other cool features including but not limit to fingerprint reader, keyboard backlit and so on. Overall, I think this is a great everyday laptop for everyone!
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: VERY heavy, hard to set up
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: When I unpacked this laptop, I could not believe how heavy it is. I was looking for something a little smaller than my current laptop, and the convertible style was a huge plus. But this laptop is WAY heavier than any laptop I've owned. I use my laptop on my lap, not on a table or desk, and this thing is way too heavy to be comfortable on my lap. And I can't use it in the tablet-mode, because it's too heavy to hold that way. Some of the keys wouldn't work, and when using the touch screen, the screen kept going black, before popping back on again. It did this over and over again. This thing is just a disaster from the word go. I'm returning it.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2025

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Once youâ€™ve unboxed the Jumper 16 Inch Laptop and marveled at its sleek design, itâ€™s time to get it up and running. Luckily, setting up this laptop is a breeze.The first step is to connect the charging cable to the laptop and plug it into a power source. While the laptop does not come with a dedicated charging brick, you can use any standard USB-C charger to juice it up. Just make sure to use a charger with sufficient wattage to ensure a faster charging time.While the laptop is charging, take a moment to familiarize yourself with the user manual. It provides helpful information on navigating the laptopâ€™s features and functions. Plus, it might have some useful tips and tricks that can enhance your overall experience.Once the laptop is fully charged, press the power button located on the side or top of the device to turn it on. Youâ€™ll be greeted with a vibrant display and prompted to set up your new Jumper 16 Inch Laptop.Follow the on-screen instructions to configure your language preference, region, and keyboard layout. Youâ€™ll also be asked to connect to a Wi-Fi network, so make sure you have your network credentials handy. I've already watched a couple of movies on it. It's great

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Very happy with this laptop, I purchased this as a gift for my two daughters for online learning.It's been a month now and they absolutely love the functionality, the color of the laptop, and the quality.I chose this brand laptop because of the amount of USB's it has (2x 3.0 and 1x 2.0), 1 USB C (the other USB C is for charging ONLY), micro SD card Slot and HDMI. The Camera has a Webcam shield, Keyboard is backlit, a numeric keypad, and Fingerprint security. They love the screen size, the keys are soft and it very portable for them. It doesn't even heat up like other laptops do, it stays pretty cool.I recommend this laptop to anyone looking for a good budget laptop for everyday use.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I must admit I was a little apprehensive purchasing a product from a company I never heard of before, but I was pleasantly surprised.  This laptop works like a charm.  It was not loaded with unnecessary programs, eliminating the constant barrage of "trials".  I'm impressed with both the picture and sound, but best of all is it's speed.  No lagging and immediate boot up.  If you are shopping for a laptop, I highly recommend a NIMO!

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the laptop extremely fast, with smooth operation and good performance for work and gaming. Moreover, they appreciate its build quality, with one customer noting it runs like lightning, and consider it good value for money, particularly for college use. The device is reasonably light for traveling and features a beautiful screen with outstanding picture quality. However, the screen resolution and battery life receive mixed reviews - while some praise the resolution, others find it terrible, and while some report decent battery life lasting about 4 hours, others mention issues with the battery not holding a charge.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic price to performance ratio if you're not into gaming.
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I originally bought this computer with the intentions of programming on the go.Let's get the bad out of the way first. This laptop is not designed, nor advertised for gaming by any stretch. You'll be able to get away with some older games but forget about getting reasonable performance at reasonable graphics levels on anything more modern. We're talking just barely getting 60fps on Spyro: Reignited Trilogy at 720p, lowest graphic preset. But that's impressive for not being a gaming laptop. Just keep your expectations in line.The good: This thing is blitzing fast in practically every other regard. This is where the SSD and CPU really take center stage. Everything is incredibly responsive and installs are very painless. Overall usage had me forgetting I wasn't on my desktop at times, so I give this a laptop a solid A+ in that regard. Boot times are damn near instant and restarting to finish installing applications happens in under 10 seconds.Battery life has yet to be tested very well so I can't comment too much on that just yet. I'll update when I get more usage out of the battery but from the get go, it seems pretty standard.Screen quality is again very standard. It's not winning any beauty contests compared to a decent ISP panel but again, it's not advertising itself as being anything spectacular in that regard. You get what you pay for and with this laptop, you're paying for the SSD/CPU performance which it absolutely nails.Style: I absolutely love the way this laptop looks. It's clean, sleek, and professional. Nothing over the top but doesn't look or feel cheap. Build quality is very solid. Obviously it's no MacBook in terms of build quality but it's also less than half the price of a MacBook so again, you get what you pay for.Sidenotes: My first unit had an odd manufacture defect on the screen; A white blotch that was only visible under certain conditions, namely over more muddy colors like off shades of white, dark blues, etc. It was incredibly distracting but I contacted Amazon who stayed on the line with me while we discussed possible solutions with ASUS and ultimately resulted in Amazon sending me a replacement unit in less than two days. The new unit has none of these issues and looks to be exactly what I was looking for in the first place. So good on both ASUS for making a decent laptop and Amazon for honoring the exchange.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Great quality laptop for the money
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I bought the Ryzen 5/ 256GB SSD variant. At $479 in Nov of 2020, with a 15'6 screen, backlit keyboard with numeric keypad and these specs, this is a fantastic laptop for the money. The quality of the screen is great and the keyboard pretty comfortable. The sound is also remarkably good, in case you need to watch something through the built-in speakers.I installed Linux straight away, so I can't review its performance under Windows, but on Linux it works definitely great. This configuration means 8 cores, and everything got recognized and was working flawlessly from the start (at least on Arch Linux, you may get different results with more conservative distros). I haven't come around configuring and testing the fingerprint sensor yet though.My usage is mostly browsing, office tasks, watching movies and programming.I am not a gamer, but do play Minecraft with my son from time to time. It does work pretty well, once you reduce the max framerate from the default 160 or so to a more reasonable 30FPS. The video card setup is definitely not good if you plan to play other more graphics intensive video games, but for the ocassional game, this would also do.As other user reported, the looks are also great, surprisingly good at this price range. It does have some Macbook vibes, which is always nice, and definitely not expected at this price.My only negative remarks are that despite the extended keyboard, the insert key requires pressing the Function key, so there is an extra complication if you use the Ctrl+Ins, Shift+Ins for copy and paste. Also, as reported in other comments, out of the 8GB of RAM, 2 are dedicated to the video card, so you actually have 6GB for the system. Wait till you receive it, and open it to check if you have the one with a SODIMM module of 4GB. I did so and ordered an 8GB module for not much, to upgrade it to the max possible total of 12GB of RAM (10GB for the system).All in all, another perfectly rounded laptop by Asus. At this price and specs there is really no other competitor. Very satisfied with my purchase.I don't have time to write many reviews, but this laptop definitely deserved a good one.
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020

productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewTitle: Excellent value for an elegant looking laptop
productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewDescription: I was looking around for a laptop, including many more expensive options, before I settled with this one.The laptop is very fast with the NVMe M.2 SSD, with a disk benchmark, I was able to reach 1.6 GB (that is gigabytes, not gigabits) read speeds per second, and 900 MB/s write speeds per second.I got this on sale, and for under $600, a Ryzen 5 quad core, 8GB DDR4 ram and 256GB SSD, it is excellent value. Not to mention the great feel of the chiclet backlit keyboard.The performance of the Vega 8 integrated graphics, is better performance than any Intel integrated graphics would be. The fans is a little audible when running HD video or more intensive tasks, although still very quiet.The battery life is average, although it can be a little bit above average if you set your settings to battery saver. Still, it should last a few hours at the least. Just a quick note, there is 6GB usable RAM rather than 8GB, as 2GB is permanently allocated to the AMD Ryzen Vega 8 GPU. Also, when first turning on the computer, there is noticable backlight bleed on the bottom two corners of the screen, while the screen is on though, the screen has good picture.The pictures for this laptop does not do it justice, I was pleasantly surprised when I received the laptop - the laptop looks better in person than it is advertised!All in all, this is the best laptop one can get for the price, hands down. Definitely recommend it for anybody who is looking for a laptop that wonâ€™t put a dent in their wallet. Good job Asus.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: This laptop holder has made a big difference in my workspace. Itâ€™s sturdy, adjustable, and well-designed, making it much easier to maintain good posture and reduce neck strain. The adjustable height and angle allow for a more comfortable viewing position, whether Iâ€™m working, watching videos, or typing for long hours.The build quality is impressive, with a strong metal frame that keeps my laptop stable without any wobbling. The open design also improves airflow, which helps prevent overheating.Overall, this stand is a great addition to any desk setup and provides both functionality and style.

productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Product came neatly boxed and on time.And this thing is just right. I'm disabled and spend a whole lot of time with my laptop in my chair. I have a swing-away tray I use for that, along with eating and such.But the constant angle was wrecking my neck, and I couldn't see the keys, as the tray sits flat.This thing is super-easy to use, with no assembly. Frail folks might need some help opening it up and getting it set right. But it is pretty stable, and lifts the angle of my monitor much higher than without, relieving my neck already, in mere days.Typing is also much easier, the angle conforming to my wrists much better, although the weight of it is now on my shoulders. Not a problem for most of what I do... If I need to use the keyboard extensively, I will just take the laptop to a table and use it without the stand.Excellent product. Very happy.

productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewDescription: I love how I can adjust the height to be ergonomic. Plus, it's sturdy for its price. I think this will last me well!

i bought this for a 12 inch tablet. fits perfectly when the tablet is vertical, has a little bit of shown space when used horizontally. tablet described is samsung galaxy tab A9. the stand is heavy, cold and sturdy. feels like metal, is probably a composite of metal and plastic. any way, this thing is super ajustable and supports crazy angles. there are two notches at the bottom, they seemed too long before i bought but they fit perfectly with the tablet in a case, protrudes just as much as the width of an otterbox case. love this thing so much i ended buying 3 of these. very recommended.
Very sturdy, great finishings, use right out of the box. I highly recommend it

So it seems sturdy enough. Not the heaviest given that it's metal...until you look a bit more closely and notice that rubber is sandwiched between ultra thin metal sheets. Each level is 4mm thick and 3.85mm is the rubber (guesstimate). Not some much a complaint as an observation on how they managed to save some money on materials.It came well packed. It doesn't have any offensively sharp edges. There's also some soft rubber padding on those little feet that stick up (wasn't apparent to me from the product pictures). The hinges use allen key bolts and what appear to be locking nuts. The threads also have some thread lock. All that to say you may be able to adjust the (super) stiffness, but be wary of the amount of torque you put on those allen keys. Not sure I'll try it myself.Overall looks like a decent product. Current 4.5 star rating seems justified.

This stand is very sturdy and portable, and it came ready out of the box. Grips on the base and laptop surface hold things in place, and tools to adjust tension are included. It hugely improves laptop work for a great price.

features: Beyond Performance: Empower your gaming and creativity with the Nitro V 15, combining a 13th Gen Intel Core i5-13420H processor with the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4050 Laptop GPU

More Games. More Fun. Windows is the GOAT of gaming. We have more game titles than any other OS. Windows has more triple-A game titles than any other OS, play popular releases solo or with friends â€“ because you know victory is sweeter when its shared.*

Power That Plays Harder. Windows offers more games titles you can't get on a Mac*. Designed for speed, impressive app performance - we have the power, graphics, and memory to keep your head in the game.**

aiReviewsSummary.text: Customers find the gaming laptop performs well, running most games spectacularly, and consider it good value for its price. The display features crisp and clear colors, and customers appreciate its gaming capabilities, with one noting it handles modern games extremely well. While the sound quality receives mixed feedback, with some finding it great while others report loud fans, the laptop's turn-on functionality and battery life receive negative reviews, with customers reporting it won't turn on for several minutes and lasting only 30 minutes to an hour.

Tengo que admitir que ha cumplido con todo en regla y fue una muy buena compra Calidad-Precio.Soy usuario gaming casual, pero no desperdicie la oportunidad de probar juegos pesados. Probamos Minecraft con Shaders Photon, tiro 110FPS y mantuvo las temperaturas entre los 60Â° C y los 67Â°C, MK 11 lo mantiene por arriba de los 69FPS y Red dead redemption en calidad Ultra por arriba de los 80FPS.En general sÃ­ el rendimiento para juegos es asÃ­ de bueno y decente, para Home Office va de maravilla de igual manera.

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: !!!!!!Buyer Beware!!!!! Black Screen Of Death Purchased New
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: Purchased this laptop new with Amazon Ada a birthday present for myself with money I had received. Upon Arrival laptop box was dented however the unit was unscathed. Plugged in installed Windows 11. installed all windows updates and Graphics Cards Updates and began gaming. At this point had only installed Opera Gx Old School RuneScape And later Far Cry New Dawn. 45 minutes into gaming playing old school the screen went black fans stills running keyboard and blue power indicator light on. No normal troubleshooting would fix this issue the only solution was hard reset by holding power button. I thought maybe an isolated incident so I tried again but the problem persisted. I reached out to Acer Customer Service Provided them with all necessary info they told me to factory reset the pc which I did however that did not fix the problem and 45 minutes into gaming black screen of death. I reached out to Acer support again they told me to try another game maybe itâ€™s the game so I installed far cry new dawn a game that fall well below the specs in this system keep in mind this is a 13th gen I5 and 40 series gpu which should be capable of playing games in high settings minimum even triple A titles. Game experienced the same black screen except in 30 minutes this time. Acer Support called a third time as they told me to do trouble shooting and if problem persisted to call them back as they were in a hurry to get off the phone. I called back a third time and this time the agent told me I had to send in the unit for repair mind you I bought this laptop for the fall semester of college which was two weeks away. They told me the only solution for me is repair and that this could take up to 3 weeks or more and there was nothing more they could for me. I requested a manager call and was told I should bypass the repair and refund through Amazon essentially saying they want nothing to do with it. Lousy product Lousy customer service that does not stand behind their products and Amazon Refund actually makes me loses close to 90 dollars on the purchase of this laptop. As someone who an it and pc enthusiast do not buy from Acer look at the bad reviews and you will see a pattern of bad quality and bad customer service and donâ€™t be fooled by the price. The color accuracy of the screen was horrible the ram was being utilized at 70 percent just running RuneScape and a web browser at the same time. Save your money and buy from a manufacturer that will Iâ€™ll resolve issues with their products and give a solution other than a 3 week lead time repair that doesent include the shipping process and 2 buisness days to get a shipping label. Will change review and update if reached out to by Acer or Amazon but not holding my breath thumbs all the way down shame on you Acer
productPageReviews.reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024

productPageReviews.reviewTitle: Ordered 12th gen and was sent a 13th gen.....
productPageReviews.reviewDescription: I did a lot of research to find a 12th Gen Intel processor... Came across the Acer Nitro 15, described in 4 Models, across the 12th to 14th gen processors, and a choice of five video configs. I chose the 12th gen with the 3060Ti. I was sent a 13th gen with the 3060Ti. I'm crossing my fingers it is not affected by the Intel Meltdown Bug....Hence Why I Ordered 12th gen... The change to the die giving the 13th gen the speed boost has a voltage bug, it's well documented... The Die width of the 14th gen is smaller, yet shares the same voltage issue due to the architecture.I have to laugh at some of the reviews, People need to know what they buy, so Here is my experience after Using it as a main computer while on a three week vacation:Setup: Basic New OS install interface. Have a MS account, or it makes a new one for you, including an outlook e-mail.Registration with Acer: Good Luck! Links back to Acer are Broken in the script making the process lengthy and a real pain in the ..... I have been attempting it for 12 days and I still have no Idea if the product is registered, it error after error after error...Email reminder after Email reminder, get the idea?Battery: Goes for about an hour and a half gaming, and about 3 hours on Wi-Fi Browsing. You Purchased a High Power Processor!! You can NOT expect any type of battery life!! If you want a long Life battery, get a processor designate as U not an H. With this one, it is best to Use it plugged in! The Battery manager allows you to cap charging at 80%. That's a nice touch, since you will more than likely use the system docked a majority of the time due in part to the HIGH POWER Processor that is advertised and installed.Fans: in Auto Mode the fans are almost unheard when browsing or working with office software, streaming videos or picture editing. When gaming the fans can spin up to a noticeable Volume. In High mode, they are quite loud at full spin when they are punching 30kRPM keeping things cool. I have found that a few water bottle or soda caps under the back corners helps drastically with keeping your HIGH POWER PROCESSOR and Video card Cool.Sound: The Spatial sound is quite amazing. It's a full 360 degree surround. It made the gaming quite immersive when you muted the games background music. Ambient sounds were clear, Background movement was easily discernable. So I'm not sure why people are complaining....Pre-Installed Software: Norton AV Sucks!! Very First removal and replacement!!! MS Office 360/Edge are Gone Because they SUCK! Nitro Sense is Sweet, but annoying with all the notifications. Nitro Sense is a Must Use for this build. It has so many features and tweaks that are quite handy for tuning the laptop to what your current usage needs are. It also has an overlay to keep you totally informed on how your critical hardware is preforming. The standard Temp/Speed/Mem/Proc/Frame rate ect all on a small overlay. Which is Handy for video rendering and gaming.Touch Pad: The touch pad supports gestures and has a finger print reader and pressure point switching. It tracks well, a with a very fine resolution. It's extremely sensitive out of the box. Some adjustment may be required.Video: Colors are crisp and clear. I was pushing 128FPS on a mediocre internet connection. The screen didn't cause eye irritation or discomfort after multiple hours of constant use.Keyboard: Standard mini QWERTY with NUM pad and Directional arrow keys. It's back lit and silent. I like it, the Wife hates it and she made me add gaming KB/Mouse. ..Other Issues: Information on the build spec is limited if available at all. I know it has DDR5 RAM installed, however it is IMPOSSIBLE to know if it is One stick or two. so you have to crack the back and VOID the warranty by opening the case to find out! If your rendering or FPS Gaming it is a necessity to Max it. The secondary NVMe, PCIe slot is limited to Gen2 as the GEN3 slot contains the main drive.Over all, I'm happy with the purchase. I got a great price for a 12th gen laptop, and received a 13th gen, so hard to complain about an additional $150 savings. Just a bit nervous about the intel Meltdown Bug....

productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewDescription: Definitivamente vale la pena el precio en promo q la compre, estuve un buen rato buscando con mi presupuesto y solo encontraba 2050 nueva o 3050 de uso en marketplace pero por los 14k que me costÃ³ esta joyita definitivamente lo vale, claro es que necesita up de ram y ssd pero por el momento me hace perfectamente lo que necesito, aÃºn no la pruebo full con videojuegos, pero ya estoy en espera 32de ram a 5200mhz que es la frecuencia que estÃ¡ manejando de fÃ¡brica e igual un SSD de 1tb de 7800/6800 respectivamente asÃ­ que con eso es la mejor opciÃ³n por el costo inicial que tuve dejando margen para darle un up y queda de rechupete, tampoco tuve ningÃºn problema con drivers, actualizaciones al primer encendido no tardÃ³ mÃ¡s de 10 segundos en lanzar la configuraciÃ³n del w11.Si puedo mÃ¡s adelante subo actualizaciones de rendimiento un saludo y espero que les sirva de referencia mi experiencia. (VenÃ­a con funda) es un plus pq pensÃ© en comprar una asÃ­ que ya no es necesario.ACTUALIZACIÃ“N, SI O SI invierte en mÃ­nimo 16 de ram, pero yo teniendo los 32 en fortnite o warzone q es lo que he probado se consume los 18 asÃ­ que ve por los 32, yo compre crucial 5200mhz que es la frecuencia que traÃ­a de fÃ¡brica, y por el ssd claro es que necesitas meterle un 1tb, ya que actualmente ya algÃºn juego pesa de 60 a 80gbACTUALIZACIÃ“N 2024 finales la tuve q devolver porque la pantalla empezÃ³ a verse blanca al encender y en fondos oscuros en las orillas y dejÃ³ de cargar tenÃ­a q estar directa a la energÃ­a, lastima me gustÃ³

Me gusto el producto se ve mejor en persona que en la foto, buenos acabados, el cargador algo grande para mi gusto pero es mas un detallito, si eres de mexico esta es la versiÃ³n con el teclado de EU Ã³sea no tiene la letra Ã‘.he corrido juegos como The Finals en el y lo  corre genial sin problemas, pero los ventiladores inician con todo, lo bueno que tiene buena ventilaciÃ³n.apex sin problemas.fornite sobrado de poderLa pantalla a pesar de ser Full HD se ve de maravilla mejor que varias pantallas 4k que e visto, gran calidad de pantalla estaba muy asÃ©ptico en esa parte pero me dejo encantado.La bateria dura lo normal, unas 4 hrs sin exigirle mucho unas 2hrs con exigencia media y 1 hr o un poco menos con exigencia a Full. tiene muy buenos colores. de lo mejor de la laptopBuena calidad de sonido para ser una lapo pero en especial buena cantidad de volumen.los puertos de buena calidad.en general vale la pena una buena opciÃ³n, mas aun si te la encuentras en oferta como fue mi caso, vale 100% la pena. le calculo una vida media de 3 a 4 aÃ±os antes que comience a quedar algo atrasada en cuestiones de gamingpero hey vale la pena.

productPageReviewsFromOtherCountries.reviewDescription: En mi opinion no encontraran ninguna laptop con las mismas especificaciones mas barata que esta, en tema de hardware es excelente, buen procesador y excelente tarjeta grafica, tomando encuenta que por el mismo precio en el mercado solo encontraras equipos con 1650 o 1650 ti, cabe resaltar que en tema de materiales deja que desear, en su mayoria es plastico y el acabado no es el mas bonito esteticamente, pero por el precio no todo podia ser bueno, realmente el equipo es bueno debido a que te da la oportunidad de expandir el almacenamiento de manera brutal, cuenta con 2 ranuras para M.2 y 1 para ssd, tambien puedes expandir la memoria a 32gb, si buscas realmente buenos componentes, esta es la mejor eleccion que puedes hacer.
